results.description:
7 miles on trail at South Mountain Reservation. Headlamps are required. You'll need them.

Trail Details: We'll, run one 7 mile loop around South Mountain Reservation. This run mostly on the mild bridle/carriage roads. If being in the woods in the dark, surrounded by animals, glowing eyeballs and strange sounds gives you the creeps, this run may not be for you. We'll make one photo stop at the waterfall. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. This is about the joy of trail running.

Public Transit: Take the 6:49 pm NJ Transit Morristown line from Penn Station to the Millburn station (travel time 40 minutes). The walk from the station to the trail head is less than a quarter mile. Return Train is 9:12.

By Car: You can meet us at the Locust Grove Parking Lot Millburn, NJ

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)

Hey folks, let's get some good booze, play some bocci, and hear some good music at Union Hall in Park Slope!  This is an awesome and HUGE bar, with lots of couches,  lots of books, and even two bocci courts and a downstairs music space!!!

http://www.unionhallny.com/

We'll meet up starting around 7:30 so we can get on the bocci schedule incase anyone wants to play.

As for bocce rules, I think we should follow the simple rules shown in this video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v3slD-qDIW8&list=FLktf6mvAXyJNUBDGYD69zbg&index=2

Union Hall is a block east from the Union St. train station for the R train.

See you guys there!!!!!

Bocce Rules:

Goal of game= to get as many balls close to the palina (white ball)

1. Throw palina down at least ½ length of court.

2. Team one throws all their balls as close to palina as possible, but ball hitting wall doesn’t count. Or, Teams take turns throwing their balls.

3. Once all balls are thrown, closest color balls get points until next closest ball is a different color, and that stops point count for that round.

4. You can also try to hit palina closer to your balls, after putting all your color balls in a group on the court.

5. Balls that hit the wall on first throw are taken out of the court.

(event is co-hosted with the Everything Brooklyn Meetup group)

http://www.meetup.com/everythingbrooklyn/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Dan by the bocce courts.
results.name: Drinks & bocce at Union Hall!!!

results.description:
What we do...

Practice is based on different forms of mindfulness including those involved in sitting and walking meditations as well as those embodied in Hatha Yoga.

Meetings always begin with a lightly guided meditation, suitable for those who have never meditated before and those who have developed their own practices.

We then transition to very basic, beginner level Hatha Yoga. Our goal is to use the positions as an additional form of body awareness, which is especially useful for persons who have difficulty utilizing seated meditations as their sole form of practice.

On a rotating basis, we engage in a variety of other practices including compassion developing exercises, walking meditations, and exercises in mindful living as well as our signature contemplative exercises. 


Why a secular, evidence-based mindfulness practice?

The Contemplative Humanism Group utilizes a secular and evidence-based series of mindfulness protocols, such as the ones developed by Jon Kabat-Zinn in his Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction Program at the University of Massachusetts Medical School. 

As such, it is recognized as an appropriate complementary treatment for a variety of challenges known to have emotionally-related components.

Because it is secularly-based, it can readily be adopted by all persons, regardless of belief system including those without a belief system.

As an evidence-based program, participants can be assured that the protocols engaged in have been scientifically validated and are known to reduce stress and increase vitality. 

We meet on first, third, and fifth Wednesdays from 7:30 - 9:00 PM for practice. We end each practice with time to socialize over light refreshments.

What do I need to bring for my first group meeting?

Yourself, wearing comfortable clothing.

A yoga mat if you have one, but no worries--we have plenty of them.

The ability to sit in a chair or a wheelchair. While several group exercises involve standing, walking, beginner level yoga poses, or sitting on a cushion, everyone is encouraged to enter practice at their own level of ability and that level of ability is honored and respected.

Contemplative Exercises

The center of our community comes from our mindful contemplation and discussion of the ideas of those who have trodden the path of life before us or are fellow travelers with us in the present.

By sharing member-selected quotations from a wide variety of Humanistic, Western, and Buddhist traditions prior to meetings, an opportunity is created for attendees to share their thoughts, feelings, and concerns about the contemplation in a supportive environment during the group. 

Suggested donation is $5.
results.name: Contemplative Humanism Group, a place to meditate

results.description:
Introduction into how our thoughts and actions affect the spiritual realm which, in turn, affects every aspect of our lives. We will examine proven approaches to transforming our lives for the better while raising our level of consciousness.

GOOD NEWS/BAD NEWS

Studies reveal that most people endure life in a state of almost constant inexplicable melancholy. An enigmatic sadness and tiredness, defeated and overwhelmed. Despite occasional “highs”, life seems to have passed them by. They no longer dream big dreams. They no longer aspire to greatness. They seldom live in the “now”. They usually wait for some future event to lighten the load. Deep down they no longer believe that true happiness can be theirs.

That’s some of the bad news. But it gets worse. If you dare suggest to them that it is THEIR thoughts and actions that attract what and who come into their life, they are likely to get upset and argue that you just don’t understand the circumstances of their life. And in their mind, they are SURE that they are right and you are wrong.

The good news is that Eastern philosophies, Western research and Judaic sources all confirm that with a little effort and training, we can transform our lives and literally become a new person. The Jewish concept of Teshuva deals with this topic extensively. But there are other teachings, meditation techniques and visualization exercises that can help one become the person they were intended to be. That person is intrinsically whole and pure and possesses unlimited potential.

In our next series of MeetUps, we will explore Jewish meditation practices and previously seldom revealed visualization exercises.  We are confident that you will feel a difference after only one meeting.  But if you make the commitment to come to all our meetings, you will discover a transformative change in you and those you attract into your life.  Our Creator wants to shower us with happiness, bliss and abundance.  He has given us a blueprint for how to attract His blessings.  Let’s review the blueprint together, raise our level of consciousness and awareness, and help each other achieve more of our unlimited potential. 

Feel free to bring up to two friends.  But please let us know in advance if you are bringing guests.  Thank you!
results.name: Introduction to Jewish Meditation, Visualization and Prayer

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON Your Sex Life and Relationships

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Hi guys! We've had our next book picked for a while...but wanted to make sure everyone knew - Cat's Cradle by Kurt Vonnegut.

Our next meeting is on Wed Nov 18th at 8pm at City Bistro. Be sure to bring ideas for the next few months picks too! Hope to see you there - Julie

"Cat’s Cradle is Kurt Vonnegut’s satirical commentary on modern man and his madness. An apocalyptic tale of this planet’s ultimate fate, it features a midget as the protagonist, a complete, original theology created by a calypso singer, and a vision of the future that is at once blackly fatalistic and hilariously funny. A book that left an indelible mark on an entire generation of readers, Cat’s Cradle is one of the twentieth century’s most important works—and Vonnegut at his very best."

results.description:
Are you a “creative” (artist, writer, architect, etc.) whose work has been affected or even inspired by psychedelics?

Do you have a story to tell about how psychedelics have changed your life?

This will be a good opportunity for you to get up and share. Although this is an “open mic” night, we’re looking for people who’d like their work or story to be featured beforehand. If you're interested in this, email me and Colin Pugh at [masked], and let us know what you’d like to discuss or present. 

So far, the following individuals have committed to presenting: 

--Anthony David Adams is an artist, activist, shaman, entrepreneur and high performance coach here in Brooklyn. He will discuss his experience with psychedelics and how they helped orient his life/career goals around intimacy and love. His most recent consumer product success is "The Love Game", a card game designed to help people fall in love and based on “The 36 Questions That Lead to Love.”

--Robert Nathan Davis is a Brooklyn based artist who used psychedelics to overcome a decades long struggle with serious depression. His psychedelic experiences have also inspired his artwork. Robert will discuss both the impact psychedelics have had on his personal and professional life. http://robertdavis.info 

--Michael Koutsoubis has recently founded a virtual reality startup geared towards serving the architecture industry. He will briefly talk about his undergraduate thesis, which involves the design of psychedelic institutions in a post-prohibition world. He wants to collaborate with writers, artists, and designers to further develop some of these ideas into a magazine.

--Colin Pugh will tell his story on how MDMA helped occasion a religious transformation, which changed his views concerning religion and ethics.

--Chase Hanna is a Rhode Island based artist and tattooist whose gift of creativity manifests via a number of mediums: painting, metal working, tattooing, sculpting, and woodwork.  Chase's creations have a habit of transfixing the viewer into a state of near-trance, evoking images of tribalism and American shamanistic aesthetics. Chase will discuss his craft and inspirations, along with displaying some of his works. https://www.facebook.com/ChaseHannaCreations/


There will be time for others to come up and share as well.

Look forward to seeing you all there!

PLEASE NOTE: We do NOT engage in or promote illegal activities during our Meetups. Don't join this group to procure, or otherwise attempt to procure illegal substances.
results.name: Psychedelics and Creativity: An Open Mic Night at the Pacific Standard

How to Gain the Competitive Advantage in 2016 in the New Jersey Foreclosure Market

New Jersey Foreclosure and Short Sale Market Presentation and Webinar

According to this article, ... "New Jersey now has the nation's top foreclosure rate" and "[t]hat deferred distress often represents properties with deferred maintenance that will sell at more deeply discounted prices"

If you are avoiding people in foreclosure or shortsale ...
If you are not marketing to people in foreclosure ...
If you are marketing to people in foreclosure with outdated leads ...
YOU ARE MISSING OUT ON AN OPPORTUNITY as well as WASTING ALOT OF MARKETING $$$

Ignoring the above is going to cost you $$$ NOW AND IN THE FUTURE

I know the challenges that a real estate investor has in dealing with people in foreclosure as well as marketing to this segment. But I have figured out a way and I can show you how.

I have been working the foreclosure market in New Jersey and New York since 2008.  Just this past month, I have received 10 good leads of which 2 turned out to be solid leads so far.

The Place:

Oiji, a new restaurant in Manhattan’s East Village, is creating a new category for Korean cuisine in New York City: Refined Authentic Korean. Exploring traditional flavors and dishes while utilizing modern cooking techniques and ingredients, artful plating and portion sizes, Oiji offers a Korean dining experience that is at once familiar and surprising, in a modern downtown setting. The intimate but stylish restaurant is accented with an open kitchen, reclaimed wood, exposed brick and ambient lighting with factory sash windows that open out to the bustling streets of downtown Manhattan.

4.5 stars on Yelp and a very good review from the NY Times.



 RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
Some people go online and they find true love. Others go online and feel tortured by the experience. Do you wonder how this online dating thing turns out for anyone at all? 

Sure -- there can be unlovely aspects to online, but what if the one, big advantage is you get to find the right person for you -- the one you wouldn't have met any other way... isn't it worth finding out how the success stories got there?

108 of my 121 first dates came from online dating. Many of those men were amazing! Join me in learning how to shift your perspective to online dating so you can finally get what you're after -- whatever that is for you.

FREE to Register - http://myaccount.maestroconference.com/conference/register/L6QC1Z6L1KYGCSHR

I have so much good news for you! 


FREE! Invite your girlfriends -- it’s a phone party!

Register here: It's required and space is limited so register now.

About me, the instructor:

Hi! I'm Wendy Newman, author of 121 First Dates. I'm committed to helping women find their own happily ever after -- that person who loves you just as you are.

I'm a dating, sex and relationship expert and I've led hundreds of workshops about understanding men, women, sex, dating, online dating, and relationships of all kinds to thousands of women internationally.

Over the past 13 years, I've interviewed thousands of men on sex, dating, relationships and women. Add to that extensive research, input from outside sources, and good old-fashioned trial and error, and I'd say it makes me someone who has something to say about men, women and dating.

Also, I'm a percipient and compassionate fellow dater who navigated my way through 120 first dates before I retired my lucky dating scarf for lucky first date #121. We live (in the Twitter-loin) in San Francisco, California.

Register Now – telephone lines are limited on the call.

http://myaccount.maestroconference.com/conference/register/L6QC1Z6L1KYGCSHR

results.description:
Come and have a great time enjoy a great workout with great people while potentially  getting a fantastic sunrise! :)  Check out the photos of prior sunrise hikes !!

Please adhere to the two golden rules!

 1) Hike Safe

2) Have Fun  :)

Please try to be the timely as the purpose of this hike is to catch the sunrise. If you are going to be late please leave a message on the meet up board.

Directions From NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.


Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip


The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

results.description:
Mark your calendars now for a BIG day of activities on
November 19! Before the regular pod meeting, there will be a pre-meeting coffee, courtesy of Virginia  Liberato of Creative Wallcoverings and Interiors, one of the sponsors of the Summit/New Providence pod. http://creativewallcoverings.com/

Virginia will share some of her creative magic as she presents some holiday decorating ideas. This exciting morning will begin at Twin Maples, 214 Springfield Avenue in Summit, at 9:45, and will lead right into our regular pod meeting, which begins at 10am.

The topic for the regular business portion of the November Summit/New Providence pod meeting is Stress Less = More Success: Incorporating Mindfulness to Your Life and Biz

(At least no one has to stress about their holiday decor anymore!) Our speaker, Jennifer Bronsnick, describes the meeting as follows:

"Chaos. Overwhelm. Indecisiveness. Stress. Anxiety. When you are an entrepreneur and running your own business these are not the adjectives that you sought out when you hung up your shingle. You probably got into business because you want to make a contribution. You want to help others. You want to make a difference in your piece of the world. YOU CAN! When you begin to incorporate mindfulness into your business (and the rest of your life) doors open; anxiety disappears; you can experience peace and confidence in each moment. All of this leads to less stress and MORE success!"

Jen has gotten rave feedback about her work. This "softer" side of B.I.G. is part of the new journey, which is made up by "Personal Journey," "Professional Development," and "Life Moments."
results.name: BIG Summit/New Providence hosts:  Less Stress = More Success

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description: You have work to do and can get it done remotely, working from home is distracting, cafes are sterile and uncomfortable, it's time to find a new environment. There's usually coffee and cookies. We have a fridge and microwave and full kitchen because it is a home afterall. There is one cat onsite named Poem so I hope you're not allergic. Did I mention it's free to come over and cowork?

results.description:
Lighting Video (and Photos!) with Practical and Available Light

Practicals is a term that is often used to describe exististing light sources as well as "non-professional" lighting you bring to the scene. There are two main reasons to work with practical light sources when making your film; Firstly, many lights may already exist in your scene, so these are just unavoidable. Secondly, your budget. 
Lighting can be a costly part of making your film and many people budget little for this key tool. Building and modifying given light sources can help create a look that is uniquely you. 

Fear not, you can make great light with practicals, some knowledge and a little bit of work. Join Daniel Norton On Set as we create several different lighting scenarios using only practical light sources.

LEARN: Why Photo Floods are dollar for dollar a great source of light. 
LEARN: How to use color temperature and a few gels to create various times of day. 
LEARN: How to build some simple lighting tools.

There will three distinct sessions of this event. 
Come for one, come for all! 
12:00pm, 2:00pm and 4:00pm

Daniel Norton is the Creative Director for Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.
results.name: FREE Demo! Filmmaking on a Budget: Lighting with (Mostly) Practical Lights

results.description:
Please join the Copyright Society’s NY Chapter for a Brownbag Lunch on 11/19. CSUSA Members $10, Student Members FREE, All Others $20. Registration required: www.csusa.org/MaybeNotFairUse

Maybe Not Fair Use? Maybe Not a Problem: The Many (Other) Defenses Against Copyright Infringement

The fair use defense has received a lot of press and attention in recent years, but there are many other significant legal defenses available to those accused of infringement. Richard Dannay, Nick Bartelt and Nancy J. Mertzel will discuss both the basic fundamentals and latest developments of defenses such as laches, abandonment, statute of limitations, lack of standing, and pre-emption. Bring your lunch and join us as the panel provides insights into this important aspect of copyright infringement litigation.
results.name: New York Chapter - Brownbag Lunch

group.name: The Copyright Society of the USA

results.description:
SIGNAL Webinar Series

Weren’t able to join us for SIGNAL? We’ve got you covered.

Join us for a rebroadcast of Twilio Product presentations, followed by a live Q&A session, where you’ll have the opportunity to ask questions and share feedback with the Twilio Product team. 

Webinar: Video: WebRTC on the Server Side
There is a lot to love about WebRTC. We'll provide deeper insight on how to get the best experience on 1:1 and multiparty voice and video conversations with tight integration with your application logic.

Register for this webinar HERE.

Register for one, some, or all of the other webinars HERE. 

July 30th @ 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET
Operating Your Application with Accounts & Monitor
Maintaining and securing your Twilio app requires full visibility into actions caused by humans and app behavior. We'll go under the hood, using live demos to give you practical skills you can take back and use immediately. 

August 13th @ 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET
Elastic SIP Trunking: Set Up a Trunk in Less Than 15 MinutesTwilio Elastic SIP Trunking provides PSTN connectivity through a global cloud platform built for resilience. This unique approach allows for elastic scaling rather than reserving capacity you may not use. 

August 27th @ 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET
IP Messaging: Real-time Communications
Integrated, not embedded. Designed to enable tight integration with user experiences and business backend tools. We’ll delve into key use cases, fundamentals, and features. 

September 10th @ 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET
Great Two-factor Authentication Experiences: Dos & Don’ts

results.description:
Hi everyone,

We are excited to bring you something a bit different for the November meetup. 

Two things:
1. NOTE different timing for this meetup - 4:30pm to 7pm
2. RSVP on this page and AT THE LINK PROVIDED... You will not be guaranteed a spot if you only RSVP on this page.


Details


Please join the Educator Open House at the New York Historical Society for wine, cheese and networking in celebration of the opening of Silicon City: Computer History Made in New York. All participants will take home a copy of the new Silicon City curriculum guide and will have an opportunity to speak with the education staff about upcoming Silicon City student and teacher programs. 

CSNYC Meetup members will have an opportunity to mingle w/ teachers from across the city and at the end of the program (6:30pm), gather and debrief for 30 min. 


To register

https://www.nyhseducationdb.org/application_direct.aspx?eid=199661


Silicon City: Computer History Made in New York 


Every 15 minutes, for nearly a year, 500 men, women, and children rose majestically into “the egg,” Eero Saarinen’s idiosyncratic theater at the 1964 World’s Fair. It was very likely their first introduction to computer logic. Computing was not new. But for the general public, IBM’s iconic pavilion was a high profile coming out party, and Silicon City will harness it to introduce New York’s role in helping midwife the digital age.

Using images, artifacts, interactives, and oral histories, the exhibition will look back at local innovations that were key to computer development, from vacuum tubes and punched cards to transistors. And it will highlight pioneering work after the 1964 Fair, such as the computer graphics revolution born in New York City a decade later. Long before Silicon Valley became synonymous with all things digital, New York was a hub for imagining, developing, and selling the technology that ultimately reshaped entertainment, commerce, and daily life.
results.name: Silicon City - Educator Open House at New York Historical Society

Two of the most anticipated multitasking features of iOS 9, that are available on various iPad models including the iPad Pro, are Slide Over and Split View. One of the challenges that developers are now facing, is designing for multiple screen dimensions.

Ronnie Rios, Consulting Engineer at FileMaker, Inc., will share some early findings on designing layouts for the multitude of screen options now available, as well as practical information that you can use in your design process to optimize your layouts with minimum effort.

Would you like to reduce complexity by half?Would you like speed gains that have been measured at more than a third (34%)Would you like layouts that work better?Would you like more consistent and therefore better looking layouts?

results.description:
“If you don’t have a patent, you don’t have a prayer on Shark Tank,” as John Oliver began his diatribe on the problems with patents.  Black humor with questionable substance, but never has there been such widespread and deep confusion about patents, from the man on the street, to the press, the courts, Congress, the Supreme Court, and President Obama.  Joking aside, how should entrepreneurs view patents?

We assemble a panel of entrepreneurs who have successfully navigated these issues and shepherded companies through the life-cycle of seeking and using patents -- working with investors and licensees.  We bolster that with patent lawyers who can update us on the fundamental legal turmoil that bears on this.

Questions include:

Should entrepreneurs invest scarce time and money in patents as potential “crown jewels,” or avoid pursuing them as costly “shiny objects?” What do investors think?  What industries care? What kinds of inventions and business ideas deserve patenting? What of the raging storm over the role of patents and what is patentable that has reduced the value and enforceability of many patents?  What about “patent reform” in the legislature and patent “death squads” in the Patent Office and the courts?  What about the disarray over patentability of software and business methods? When and how can one expect to successfully enforce or monetize a patent?

PLEASE REGISTER ON OUR SITE VIA EVENTBRITE:

http://mitefnyc.org/eventbrite-events/?event=17835315910


Moderator 


James R. Klaiber, Counsel, Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP

Jim Klaiber specializes in patent law for clients in automotive, telecommunication, and software technologies, and is a former Bell Labs researcher. He earned mechanical engineering degrees from MIT, Berkeley, and Michigan, and his law degree is from Fordham. Jim is ex-Chair of MITEF-NYC, and is the Chair of the N.Y. City Bar Patents Committee.

Panel

Catriona Collins, Special Counsel, Cowan Liebowitz & Latman, P.C. 

Catriona Collins focuses on intellectual property disputes and counseling. She has handled patent disputes in various technologies, including software, business methods, mechanical and electronic devices and pharmaceutical drugs. She also teaches international patent law as an adjunct at NYU.    

Orin Herskowitz, Columbia University, Vice President of Intellectual Property and Tech Transfer

In addition to his role as Vice President, Orin Herskowitz serves as Executive Director of Columbia Technology Ventures, which manages more than 350 invention disclosures emerging from Columbia’s research labs each year, leading to over 100 license deals and over 20 new start-ups annually. Mr. Herskowitz has served on boards or as the Principle Investigator for several innovation and entrepreneurship-focused initiatives, including the NYC Media Lab, PowerBridgeNY, and the Columbia Coulter Translational Partnership. Prior to joining Columbia, he spent seven years with the Boston Consulting Group's New York office.

Alex Mashinsky CEO, Novatel Wireless [inventor/entrepreneur/investor and public company CEO].

 Mr. Mashinskyhas served as director since April 2014 and Chief Executive Officer since June 2014.  He has served as Managing Partner of Governing Dynamics since 2004. Governing Dynamics is an early stage investment and development company. Between May and December 2013, Mr. Mashinsky served on the board of directors of Tellabs, a publicly traded telecommunications company, until it was acquired in December 2013. In 2004, Mr. Mashinsky founded Transit Wireless, a wireless distributed antenna systems company that provided wireless data coverage to 300 of New York City's subway stations. Between 1995 and 2003, Mr. Mashinsky founded and operated companies in the information technology sector, including Arbinet. Mr. Mashinsky attended Tel Aviv University and Israel Open University.

Richard Reisman, President, Teleshuttle Corporation.  [inventor/entrepreneur]

Reisman has about 50 patents licensed by over 200 companies.  After a wide-ranging career in IT and online services, he became an online software/service entrepreneur, then shifted to patents as Plan B.  That led to partnership with an NPE, patent infringement suits against Microsoft and Apple, and a sale for $35 million to Intellectual Ventures. His second patent family was sold to RPX, the first defensive patent aggregator.  More recent patents were sold to an NPE, then licensed to RPX members. He has an AB in Applied Math from Brown University and an MS in Operations Research from Lehigh University.

Richard A. Robbins, CEO, TherapServices LLC. [inventor/entrepreneur]

In 2003, Richard co-founded TherapServices, which serves the developmental disabilities community.  He holds a Bachelor’s in Economics from Brandeis and a Harvard MBA.  Richard was an investment banker before becoming a financial advisor, investor, founder, and manager of a number of companies dependent on large, secure, and reliable technical systems. 

Thanks to Our Sponsor:

https://s.evbuc.com/https_proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmitefnyc.org%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2015%2F09%2FSponsor-Anchin.jpg&sig=ADR2i7-ErONo5OU808PKJBEcCqy3qx9p9A

Co-organizer:

New York City Bar Association, Committee on Patents
results.name: Panel: Patents for Entrepreneurs – Crown Jewels or Shiny Objects?

results.description:
Tout Va Bien- “Beaujolais Nouveau Day”
311 West 51st (8th and 9th avenue)
Thursday, November 19th
5:45pm optional drinks, 6:30 dinner
$71 3-course meal, unlimited wine, coffee/tea, tax & tip.

Please RSVP here but in order to secure a spot you must prepay at http://thesinglegourmet.net/event/tout-va-bien/ You can not just show up to our events as we average 20-30 members and everyone must prepay in advance. Seating is assigned by demographic and restaurants need a final headcount before we show up. This 1948 family run restaurant is one of the best French restaurants in the theater district and has been a regular for our group for many years. As in years past, they are willing to help us celebrate another November tradition, one that falls on the third Thursday of the month- Beaujolais Nouveau Day. When it first started in the Beaujolais region of France in 1937 it was actually on the 15th of December, but now at 12:01am on the third Thursday of each November, from little villages and towns across this region, millions of cases of Beaujolais Nouveau begin their journey to Paris for immediate shipment to all parts of the world: “Le Beaujolais Nouveau est arrivé!” By the time it is over, 65 million bottles, nearly half of the region's total annual production, will be distributed around the world. The Gamay grapes (the only grapes permitted to be used in production), by law must be picked by hand (only Champagne shares this requirement too), and must come from the Beaujolais AOC. Beaujolais Nouveau is intended for immediate drinking, as it doesn't improve with age and is best served slightly chilled. This fresh and fruity red is the result of a quick fermentation process that ends up with a tasty, clean wine that is enjoyed by palates all over the world. The most well-known producer is Georges Duboeuf, who is credited as one of the marketing geniuses behind the wine. Selling this young red was viewed by some vintners as a means to clear large quantities of wine at decent profits, which would create a much-needed cash flow shortly after harvest. As we know, it has become a worldwide race to be the first to try this new wine after the harvest and we will be drinking it all night at our dinner- the FIRST day it arrives! Our traditional French menu includes moules mariniere, pate maison, boeuf bourguignon, saumon provencale, coq au vin, hanger steak, creme caramel, mousse au chocolat, tarte tatin or crem brulee.
results.name: Tout Va Bien

• Rob Spectre, head of developer evangelism at Twilio: SMS for Humans: Using NLP and Python To Build Text Interfaces


• David Mauro, lead iOS developer at BuzzFeed: Unpacking Mattress, A Framework for Offline Caching on iOS


Code Driven NYC features fascinating technical and organizational talks from experienced engineers and leaders. 

This is a developer-only audience (i.e., no recruiters, etc.) and it is completely free to join and attend. Join us for an evening where all attendees are active software developers, with food/drink/networking before and after great speakers, and excellent conversations about development and engineering.


Schedule: doors open & networking begins at 5:45pm; talks begin at 6:15pm; networking continues at about 7:30pm.

Code Driven NYC is organized by FirstMark, an early stage venture capital firm based in New York City. Our mission is to partner with exceptional entrepreneurs who are changing the world by solving meaningful problems. We are privileged to work alongside the founders of remarkable businesses like Pinterest, Lumosity, NewsCred, Tapad, Shopify, Riot Games, and more.
results.name: Code Driven #4

group.name: Code Driven NYC: Software Engineering and Development

results.description:
(This is a closed meetup for a pre-designated group of 9 total players. If you have a interest in playing let me know and I may be able to get a second group going.)
In the bitter cold of a land mired in eternal winter, hunters take the shape of wolves to better kill their prey. They stalk the snow-filled forests on paws of deadly silence. Powerful and swift, these evil shapechangers roam the land at will, murdering those who oppose them and plundering the weak. At the head of this pack paces the great Black Wolf of the wood. Are you clever enough to survive against villains who are stronger, faster, and fiercer than any you have ever encountered? The Black Wolf awaits your answer in the biting cold....

results.description:
Join us for a special event with Dr. Emmanuel Mignot, one of the world's leading narcolepsy researchers. Dr. Mignot runs the Stanford Center for Narcolepsy, and is a leader in both research and treatment of narcolepsy.

Narcolepsy Network is generously providing the venue, and will also provide water and light snacks.

Find out more about Dr. Mignot at http://med.stanford.edu/narcolepsy/mignot.html and http://med.stanford.edu/narcolepsy.html

results.description:
Electronics Night is an occasional study group on some intermediate or advanced topic in electronics. This month’s session will have a short presentation introducing ARM Cortex-M0 and Cortex-M0+ microcontrollers, including:

• Architectural overview

• Part selection


• GCC compiler and linker


• Debuggers and bootloaders


Some familiarity with another type of microcontroller is assumed.

results.name: Essentials for Starting Your Business - Workshop

results.description:
All Bisexual, Non-monosexual, and all other Queer-identified and Bi-friendly people are invited to come join people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic oriented discussion at  BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.

about us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest is a bisexual social discussion group serving the New York City metropolitan area since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals and bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion group session, at 8 o'clock we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion. We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

results.description:
The Hatchery opens its doors to a fast paced New York style pitch event.

Hatchery style honesty. In ways others may be too polite to share. It's what you need to hear about your startup, covering marketing, finance, technology, business, presentation, and more.

Investors:   

Presenters:   

What's the point?

1. Pitching practice
2. Honest feedback about your company

How it works:

1. RSVP to attend

2. We accept pitches on a rolling basis and select five companies to pitch at each AYS event. We strongly advise that you attend an event prior to submitting your pitch

3. If you would like to pitch, send materials in advance to: [masked]
- we need PowerPoint and executive summary
- deadline is 1 week before the event
- file naming: company name (1 word), underscore, deck or summary
ex. hatchery_deck.ppt, hatchery_summary.doc
- put both documents in 1 email, do not send separately

4. We will not wait for the guests to arrive. Doors open at 6pm. The event begins  at 6:30pm and ends at 8:30pm.

5. It will be FAST!

6. There is no Q&A. We can talk after the event.

Format:
5 minute entrepreneur pitch
5 minute panel critique

The Powerpoint:
Please address all of these eleven points in your slides:
1. your team
2. what your product/service does
3. what issue/pain is it looking to solve/address
4. what is the solution
5. what is the addressable market
6. what is the competitive landscape
7. any current customer/client/pilot pipeline
8. what is the revenue stream/source
9. what are your financial projections
10. how much are you looking for in investment
11. what will you do with the money, how will it be spent

Entrepreneurs who take this seriously will absolutely benefit.

Advance tickets $10; Day of $20; At door $20

results.description:
At a Glance:
Hiring pros share their insider tips for rocking the interview, then give you the chance to practice your interview skills and get direct feedback.

Why Attend?

- The thought of a job interview makes your knees buckle.
- Your least favorite words in the English language are “tell me about yourself.”
- You want to practice your interview skills in a small, supportive group.
- You want to know how to express your personality while still being professional.
- You want to meet real recruiters and other young creatives!

How it Works:
- Reps from top NYC companies will answer your questions on what they look for in an interview.
- Then, you’ll break off into small groups and practice answering interview questions with those reps and your peers.
- Not only will you benefit from practice, but you’ll be able to hear how your peers answer and the feedback they get.
results.name: Land the Job: An Interactive Interview Workshop

results.description:
According to Forbes, 8 out of 10 small businesses fail in the first year! Having a good brand, great skills and special knowledge about your industry is not enough. In order to succeed, one needs to acquire excellent business skills.   


With careful planning, starting and running your own business successfully is entirely possible. Many companies lack capital at the outset, yet find success by following smart business management strategies.

Topics covered in this session: Market research, marketing, prospecting and lead generation, getting to know your customers, making sales, dealing with your competition, managing your business, your professional business image, time management, how much to charge/setting prices, keeping books, mistakes to avoid, dealing with failure, startup business plan, web presence, resources and internet surfing.


Please note that this workshop is part of a series and may be taken individually. The subsequent lectures will compliment this one.

CAPACITY IS LIMITED TO 20 PEOPLE - This is a multi group event. The RSVP list on this page is only a portion of those actually attending. 

Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor, business coach and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship at New York University -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.


MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!


Prepaid registration is: $25
$40 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

Click here to purchase and print your ticket:
</a>

<a href="https://goo.gl/Zso9lF">https://goo.gl/Zso9lF

Remember to bring your ticket. 


Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait!
Tickets should be purchased in advance.


============================== 
Join our business group on Facebook 
Our main parent website is http://www.businessonashoestring.com
============================== 

Comments from recent events:

Very informative ...The workshop makes you look at what you are doing and where you want to focus - Robin Antar 

The info based on Roger's experience was very stimulating - Deborah Schull


I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved it! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres


I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham


As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people - Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

results.description:
Get your ticket at

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/2015-fuller-challenge-conferring-ceremony-tickets-18759593449

Now in its 8th annual cycle, The Fuller Challenge invites scientists, designers, architects, activists, entrepreneurs, artists and planners from all over the world to submit their innovative solutions to some of humanity’s most pressing problems. A $100,000 prize is awarded to support the development and implementation of one outstanding strategy

THE 2015 FULLER CHALLENGE SEMI-FINALISTS ARE:

596 Acres: Living Lots

is an adaptable, open source land-access platform and dynamic community empowerment initiative that works to identify and transform unused urban spaces.(Founded in Brooklyn in 2011 -  https://www.facebook.com/596Acres)


Agrarian Trust

is nurturing the birth of a paradigm shifting, cooperatively owned agricultural commons system, using various mechanisms to ensure intergenerational stewardship of America’s farmland.

*Algae Systems: The Water/Energy Nexus has developed an innovative “industrial ecology” process using algae to provide cost-effective wastewater treatment, remove CO2 from the atmosphere, and yield clean water, bio-fuels, and fertilizers.


bioMason “grows” durable, environmentally sustainable bricks from globally abundant, renewable nutrients and minerals in a process that mimics the formation of coral reefs through bio-mineralization.


Casa Pueblo de Adjuntas: Forest School combines grassroots conservation, ecological education, and community development in an inspiring model for ecological stewardship built upon a 35-year track record in Puerto Rico.


*Community Architects Network has grown a facilitation network across 19 countries in Asia, using the participatory design process as a vehicle for transformational community change and upholding their motto to “let the people be the solution”.


*Drylands Resilience Initiative and HAZEL aims to fuse design, science, and policy and to support coordinated, whole-systems decision-making at multiple scales by providing both granular and holistic data analyses of water flows in the built environment.


*GreenWave presents a radical new form of aquaculture: multi-species 3D ocean farming, which entails a low-cost, high-yield, zero-input system that filters water, sequesters carbon, restores habitats, and creates economic opportunity.


*Mahila Housing SEWA Trust: Climate Resiliency Initiative will build upon an impressive history of community development work, engaging diverse stakeholders in order to identify appropriate technologies for climate resilience in poor urban communities in South Asia.


*The Nubian Vault Programme: A Roof, A Skill, A Market has systematized, adapted, and replicated an ancient Nubian vault structure into a low-cost, sustainable, economically empowering housing solution for both rural and urban areas in the Sahel region of Africa.


Omega Global Initiative has evolved a broad-reaching vision involving algal biofuel production, water recycling, solar energy production, aquaculture, and more, seeking to adapt a highly integrative system for diverse locations worldwide.


One People One Reef combines traditional knowledge and conservation practices with modern science in order to find comprehensive solutions to declining fisheries and degraded reefs in Pacific-island communities.


Project Drawdown unites over 200 individuals and institutions in a coalition to research, analyze, and catalyze climate solutions, quantifying their impacts and using an open-source database to work towards drawdown of excessive CO2 and other greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.


Sandele Eco-Retreat and Learning Centre takes a comprehensive approach to eco-tourism, working closely with the local population toward community development, ecological conservation, and education in an inspiring model for the future of community-owned tourism.


Warka Water 3.2, inspired by Ethiopian vernacular architecture and basket weaving as well as Buckminster Fuller’s geodesic dome, is a lightweight, modular tower made from locally available bamboo and natural fiber ropes, which harvests water from ambient air to provide clean water to rural communities.

*These Finalists will be represented at the Awards Ceremony.

The Winner is GreenWave!
results.name: Attend Buckminster Fuller's 2015 Fuller Challenge Awards Ceremony

results.description:
ROBYN CRANE talks MONEY!

And the usual goodies - networking and sandwiches, all in one exciting package!

More about the event:

"Everyone has money issues. Identifying and overcoming yours is crucial to your success. If you're not aware of these key elements, your career could be in danger; without you even knowing it.

This talk is for you:

if you want to make more money
if you want to protect the business or job you have
if you want to grow your success, and sustain it long-term
if you want to improve every area of your life

This talk will help you:

* Identify how your beliefs & behaviors about money are hurting your success
* Learn the 5 Money Types to dramatically improve professionally and in life
* Discover the 3 Steps to Get In Control of your money, to skyrocket your career
* Uncover your biggest Money Mistakes, so you can protect your most valuable asset - your income

Money & Relationship Expert, Robyn Crane is the host of the TV show, Financial G-Spot, Radio show, Let's Talk Money and #1 International Best Selling Author. Her blueprint for financial success has been featured on Fox Business News, The Motley Fool and SavingsAccount.com.

She's an engaging and in-demand speaker who is regularly invited to speak at companies, women's conferences, chambers of commerce, entrepreneurial groups and various types of organizations around the country."


FREE for Dues Paying NJCN members

Register here: http://www.njcreatives.org/meeting-info/details/123-master-your-money-accelerate-your-success.html

results.description:
If you are like me, you probably starting off as an entrepreneurial with an idea, and believed the idea that if you build it they will come.  


Well it's not true. It no longer works to build something that seems like a good idea to you. You have to build what is a good idea to your customers. Customers? How do you get those if you haven't got something to sell yet? 


Building your email list doesn't require having a polished product. Though it does require you get creative with what you have. You have to figure it out if you are going to make it as an entrepreneur.  


At our next meetup we are going to talk about the super creative work Bryan Harris (http://videofruit.com) has been doing. We will be actively building our email lists at the meetup!
results.name: Platform Builders - Build Your Email List

results.description:
Please join us for a roundtable training on:

Shot@Life: How to Get Involved

Shot@Life aims to ensure that children around the world have access to life-saving vaccines. Through education, advocacy, and fundraising we strive to decrease vaccine-preventable childhood deaths and give every child a shot at a healthy life no matter where they live.

We are calling on young professionals, parents, community advocates, bloggers or fundraisers to join our movement to provide children in the developing world with a shot at life! Join us on November 19th to receive the training and tools to help drive sustainable change for children in developing countries.

November 19, 2015
6:00pm-8:00pm

Speakers include:
Alan Kissick, Partnership Officer, Shot@Life
Liz Clapp, Partner Development Associate, Shot@Life

Center for Social Innovation
601 West 26th Street
Suite 325
New York, NY 10001

Please RSVP to Melinda Richardson at [masked] by November 16.

* Refreshments will be served.
--

The UN Foundation's Shot@Life campaign educates, connects and empowers Americans to champion vaccines as one of the most cost-effective ways to save the lives of children in developing countries. A national call to action for a global cause, the campaign rallies the American public, members of Congress, and civil society partners around the fact that together, we can save a child’s life every 20 seconds by expanding access to vaccines. By encouraging Americans to learn about, advocate for, and donate to vaccines, Shot@Life aims to decrease vaccine-preventable childhood deaths and give every child a shot at a healthy life.
results.name: UN Foundation's Shot@Life Campaign Training

results.description:
The 70s was arguably the most productive period for Classic Rock.

Bands like Led Zeppelin, Santana, Pink Floyd & The Allman Brothers, that first released albums in the 60s, produced some of their finest music during this decade which also gave birth to bands like Blondie the Police & the Cars that would go on to even greater fame during the 80s.

It was the decade of Dark Side of the Moon, Zepplin IV, Thick as a Brick & Abraxas so join us as we celebrate the music of the 70s!

It will feature:

The best classic rock the 70s had to offer!

results.description:
As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups.

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.

Bitcoin Center NYC

25 Cleveland Place

New York, NY 10012

Find Bitcoin Center NYC on Facebook, LinkedIn, Meetup, and Twitter.

All guests of Bitcoin Center NYC are required to sign in.  Media must RSVP using [masked].

This workshop introduces AutoCAD software for creating and editing 2D geometric shapes in preparation for manufacture. results.description:
Join us at Revolution Yoga for Restorative Yoga weekly! Restorative Yoga is a gentle to basic passive practice taught through Revolution’s unique brand of Restorative Yoga. Students are propped in postures with bolsters, blankets, blocks, straps and sandbags on the floor. During class, students are guided through relaxation meditation and receive hands-on adjustments to work on sacred yogic acupressure points (marma). Class ends with Yoga Nidra (yogic sleep), one of the most powerful relaxation practices available to our tradition. Each class is sequenced for the season (ayurvedically) balancing the body. Our flavor of restorative is formulated to boost immunity and resilience, act on the nervous system to spark our inner healing mechanisms, help you sleep better at night and imbue you with feelings of peace and well-being.

Restorative takes place every Monday @ 9:30am, Tuesday @ 6:00pm and Thursday @ 6:00pm!
Drop in price $20/ New Student Special $40 for an unlimited month.
We hope to see you there!
results.name: Restorative Yoga @ Revolution Yoga

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member.


To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: 28 East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City. To enter, please press buzzer #2 outside the red door for the Gallery/Lounge on the 1st Floor. PLEASE attend the meeting only if you RSVP since the space available is limited.
results.name: Graybar Toastmaster meeting!

group.name: Graybar Toastmasters - Become a skilled speaker!

results.description:
Would you like to -

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com

results.description:
The meeting is TODAY, you MUST RSVP directly to  http://www.unigroup.org/unigroup-rsvp.html by 3PM to be on the list for building security. We can't print it during the meeting :"/

Our Intel contact had to postpone :-(

The Intel Architecture Roadmap Meeting will be rescheduled.


Keeping with the theme of CPU architecture:


Speaker:  Pavel Anni, Solaris Hands-on Labs, Oracle Corporation


This presentation will cover recent news regarding the Oracle SPARC/Solaris platform.  We will talk about new SPARC M7 processor and systems, new Oracle Solaris 11.3 release and SPARC virtualization technologies.  We will also discuss Solaris workshops and hands-on labs that we use to get our customers up to speed with the new Solaris features and best practices.


As usual, check unigroup.org for the latest details.

To REGISTER for this event, you MUST RSVP by using the Unigroup Registration Page: http://www.unigroup.org/unigroup-rsvp.html

UPDATE: we added a 2nd speaker: Jeff Victor will co-present with Pavel:

Jeff's 28-year computer career has included software development,system and network administration, and pre-sales consulting. His expertise in operating systems, virtualization and resource management is regularly requested by major corporations.  He was the Principal Author of the book _Solaris 10 System Virtualization Essentials_, and the creator of the Solaris Zones FAQ and the 'zonestat' open-source program.


Jeff is a regular contributor and speaker at corporate and industry events.  His blog can be found at http://blogs.oracle.com/jeffv.  He received a Bachelor of Science degree (Computer Science) from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in Troy, New York. In his spare time, he builds and launches high-power rockets and manages automated wildlife cameras. He lives in New York with his wife and daughter.
results.name: CHANGE OF TOPIC & 2nd speaker: Solaris 11.3 + SPARC M7 Processor Release Meeting

A Database Month event:

Redis is an open source (BSD-licensed), in-memory, data structure store, used as database, cache and message broker.

In this talk you will learn about the unique Redis functions and data structures that form an important part of most web scale applications.
