results.description:
Join us for a discussion panel with data scientists from Greenhouse, the New York Times, Dow Jones / WSJ, Via, and YipitData.

We'll discuss projects, tools, challenges, and insights from the perspective of data scientists working in the field. We'll also explore ways the practice of data science is growing and evolving.

Confirmed Panelists:

Anne Bauer is a data scientist at the New York Times, where she is currently working on business problems related to article readership and newspaper circulation. This past winter she was a fellow at Insight Data Science, making the transition to data science from academia. She received her Ph.D. in physics from Yale University and held research positions in astrophysics and cosmology in Munich and Barcelona before coming to the New York Times.

Noga Neeman is a data scientist at Via, an on-demand transit start-up, where she works with customer and driver data in order to predict demand and understand usage patterns. Before that, she was a fellow at Insight Data Science, which allowed her to make the transition from her PhD research in Computational Ecology at Drexel University.


W. Kevin Zhu is a data engineer at YipitData, a research company that analyzes web data for institutional investors. Previously, Kevin worked as an investment analyst at New Holland Capital. He studied operations research and financial engineering at Princeton University, and has passed all 3 CFA exams. 


Andrew Zirm received his PhD in Physics (Astrophysics thesis) from Johns Hopkins University. He studied galaxies in the distant universe during several postdocs and before becoming an Insight Fellow in the Summer of 2014 was a professor in Copenhagen, Denmark. Andrew is the first (and still only) Data Scientist at Greenhouse Software, a SaaS recruiting optimization platform based in NYC.  

Tom Vincent is currently a data scientist at Dow Jones / Wall Street Journal, where he spends his time between data journalism work with the newsroom, business problems related to the WSJ subscriber base, and building data products using Newswire data. He received a Ph.D in BioStatistics and held a research position in computational biology at Weill Cornell Medical College. His transition from academia to data science was facilitated by the Insight Data Science program, which he was a part of during the summer of 2014. Finally, Tom also has a strong background in whiskey.

Our moderator, Emily Gould, is a Senior Analyst of Data Product and Performance Marketing for American Express.
results.name: Data Science in Practice: Greenhouse, the New York Times, Via, and YipitData

results.description:
Byte Academy, the first fulltime Python Fullstack coding bootcamp in New York City and the first ever with a FinTech (financial technology) program will hold a networking and informational event.


Did you know that the average salary for Python programmers out of bootcamp is $80,000?

During the evening we will explore the significance of the FinTech, learn why we chose to teach Python vs. Ruby; and help you understand the rampant technological "disruption" of industry.  We will also discuss our curriculum, application process and other aspects of Byte's coding bootcamp, an education form generating buzz recently.

There will be networking with instructors, students, staff, FinTech and tech community members.  There will be a presentation and refreshments will be served. 

About  Byte Academy:

Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python.  Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology).  Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program - recently declared as the highest paid programming language - and the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay zero until they find a job. 

Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its December Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes 

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

results.description:
DATE CHANGE: NOVEMBER 19, 2015 (THURSDAY) 6:30PM

NYC ATHEISTS MONTHLY MEETING

SPEAKER: JERRY COYNE , Ph.D. Professor, Department of Ecology and Evolution, Biological Science.


SUBJECT: "The Best Answers I Have Heard About Atheism".

We will listen to an interview by Brian Lehrer (WNYC) interviewing Coyne about Atheism. Then we will Skype Coyne for followup questions.

He claims that religion and science are fundamentally incompatible, that only rational evaluation of evidence is capable of reliably discovering the world and the way it works, and that scientists who hold religious views are only reflective of the idea "that people can hold two conflicting notions in their heads at the same time". He has argued that the incompatibility of science and faith is based on irreconcilable differences in methodology, philosophy, and outcomes when they try to discern truths about the universe.

LOCATION: SLC Conference Center, 15 West 39th St. (3rd Floor)


COST: $10 Donation covers room rental.

Dave Nielsen, Developer Advocate, Redis Labs

RSVP NOW at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/226717337/

A Database Month event:
http://www.DBMonth.com/database/redis-data-structures

Redis is an open source (BSD-licensed), in-memory, data structure store, used as database, cache and message broker.

In this talk you will learn about the unique Redis functions and data structures that form an important part of most web scale applications. You will also see examples of how Redis performs under the challenges created by high speed data interactions; plus you will have the opportunity to download the demos and try them for yourself.

Dave Nielsen, Developer Advocate, Redis Labs

Dave joined Redis Labs as a Developer Advocate. He organizes hackathons, workshops and other events to help developers learn when and how to use Redis.

Prior to Redis Labs, Dave was the co-founder and lead organizer of CloudCamp, a community of Cloud Computing enthusiasts in over 100 cities around the world. Dave has also worked in developer relations at PayPal, Strikeiron and Platform D.

Dave gained modest notoriety when he proposed to his girlfriend in the book PayPal Hacks

results.description:
Our monthly Third Thursday Free Artist Workshop is back at Materials for the Arts with Artist in Residence Juan Hinojosa.  During this collage making activity workshop, Hinojosa will guide participants through an art making tutorial, exploring elements of duality, symmetry and color matching. Food and light refreshments will be provided. This event is perfect for bringing a few friends, a date or those who are simply interested in art, collage making and artist Juan Hinojosa. Open to the public. Bring a friend! RSVP to secure your seat!

About the artist: Juan Hinojosa is a mixed-media artist who currently lives and works in New York. Constructed from found objects, his complex collage-drawings, intimately challenge greed, obsessive consumption, and the social stratification of American culture. Hinojosa received his BFA from Parsons School of Design and was awarded residencies at both the Vermont Studio Center and Aljira Center for Contemporary Art. His acceptance into the first New York Foundation for the Arts “Artist Boot Camp” in 2010 led to an interview in the New York Times. Hinojosa’s exhibitions include Queens Museum of Art (New York), the 2011 biennial at El Museo del Barrio (New York), and a solo exhibition at Allegra LaViola Gallery (New York).

"The glamorization of wealth and power via fashion magazines and television can cast a spell on just about anyone. Growing up in a low-income family, the desire to have more then you could afford became a constant struggle. This led to my obsession with high-end goods, superheroes, and geometrical symmetry. As I go around the city collecting discard items related to these influences I re-purpose them as a tool to draw with. " - Juan Hinojosa
results.how_to_find_us: Located at Materials for the Arts.
results.name: Third Thursday Artist Workshop

results.description:
How signing up works: First come first serve

The Place:


DBGB Kitchen and Bar is Chef Daniel Boulud’s downtown place where the French brasserie meets the American tavern. Guests enjoy 12 varieties of house-made sausage, mouthwatering burgers and towering shellfish platters, in addition to seasonal Lyonnais-inspired bistro cooking. For beer lovers, there are over 20 drafts to choose from and another 75 by-the bottle, plus a full wine list. At dessert, dig into the classics: baked Alaska, soufflés and ice cream sundaes.


Interiors take their cue from the Bowery’s history as New York’s industrial restaurant supply neighborhood with floor to ceiling shelves stocked with the restaurant’s own tools, tableware and dry goods.


RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
In recognition of the "United Nations Year of the Soil," the NYC Sierra Club and the United Nations Association of the United States, Queens Chapter, are co-sponsoring this event. 

Drawing from ancient knowledge and cutting edge science, ""Symphony of the Soil" is an artistic exploration of the miraculous substance, soil.  By understanding the elaborate relationships and mutuality between soil, water, the atmosphere, plants and animals, we come to appreciate the complex and dynamic nature of this precious resource. The film also examines our human relationship with soil, the use and misuse of soil in agriculture, deforestation and development, and the latest scientific research on soil’s key roll in ameliorating the most challenging environmental problems of our time. Filmed on four continents, featuring esteemed scientists and working farmers and ranchers, "Symphony of the Soil" is an intriguing presentation that highlights possibilities of healthy soil creating healthy plants creating healthy humans living on a healthy planet.

Contributions toward the cost of the room are gladly accepted

results.description:
Montclair Environmental Affairs office and Community Green present another eye-opening environmental movie – Just Eat It – dives into the issue of food waste from farm, through retail, all the way to the back of your own fridge.

We all love food. As a society, we devour countless cooking shows, culinary magazines and foodie blogs. So how could we possibly be throwing nearly 50% of it in the trash? Filmmakers and food lovers Jen and Grant dive into the issue of food waste. After catching a glimpse of the billions of dollars of good food that is tossed each year in North America, they pledge to quit grocery shopping cold turkey and survive only on foods that has been discarded. In a nation where one in ten people is food insecure, the images they capture of squandered groceries are both shocking and strangely compelling.  Just Eat It looks at our systemic obsession with expiry dates, perfect produce and portion sizes, and reveals the core of this seemingly insignificant issue that is having devastating consequences around the globe. Just Eat It brings farmers, retailers, inspiring organizations, and consumers to the table in a cinematic story that is equal parts education and delicious entertainment.

Join us for the film and discussion following. This is one of a series of free Environmental Film Screenings put on by CommunityGreen.org. For more information contact Marnie at[masked] or [masked].
results.name: Montclair Environmental Movie Night: Just Eat It

results.description:
This is a free event.


Come join us for the Second Annual Philosophy Day at the City College of New York!

In establishing World Philosophy Day, UNESCO highlighted the importance of our discipline, especially for young people, underlining that "philosophy is a discipline that encourages critical and independent thought and is capable of working towards a better understanding of the world and promoting tolerance and peace." 

The 2015 keynote address will take place on the CCNY campus, on Thursday, 19th November, beginning at 6:30pm in the North Academic Building, room 0/201 (see here for directions and map). Students, faculty, and members of the public are invited and warmly encouraged to participate! A reception with the speaker will follow the talk. Join us for food and conversation with our keynote speaker!

</a>The 2015 WPD speaker will be <a href="http://www.princeton.edu/%7Epsinger/">Peter Singer (Princeton University). Peter is an Australian moral philosopher. He is currently the Ira W. DeCamp Professor of Bioethics at Princeton University, and a Laureate Professor at the Centre for Applied Philosophy and Public Ethics at the University of Melbourne. He specializes in applied ethics and approaches ethical issues from a secular, utilitarian perspective. 

He is known in particular for his book, Animal Liberation (1975), a canonical text in animal rights/liberation theory. For most of his career, he supported preference utilitarianism, but in his later years became a classical or hedonistic utilitarian, when co-authoring The Point of View of the Universe with Katarzyna de Lazari-Radek. The title of Peter's keynote address will be: "The most good you can do: effectively aiding humans and other animals." 

https://sites.google.com/site/philosophydayatccny/_/rsrc/1441904688189/keynote-speaker/petersingersmall2-0.jpg?height=112&width=200
results.name: Second Annual Philosophy Day at City College of NY, Keynote Speaker Peter Singer

results.description:
Was an ancestor or is a family member an artist/crafter/designer? Did you inherit a tool of their trade? What or who inspired you to create at the start of your career? Or now? Is there a card/letter you take out to read when you’re feeling down? A favorite mug or sweater that comforts you or brings a smile to your face? Bring photos, letters, lockets or locks of hair, cameras, jewelry, paintbrushes, woodworking tools, aprons, books, paintings or prints & any other object that represents or connects you to art! Bring your ephemera, your textiles, tools & inspirational objects. Everyone is welcome to share with a 3 min limit. Get to know one another through a personal object & its tale. And remember you don't have to show & tell... you can just look & listen.

Join us for the third in a Fall Series of our "Meet the Makers" events which will combine a story sharing show & tell with an opportunity to meet the artists who will bring samples of their arts and crafts to sell.
results.name: Show &Tale: Artists, Inspiration & Tools

results.description:
Come join us for the Second Annual Philosophy Day at the City College of New York!

In establishing World Philosophy Day, UNESCO highlighted the importance of our discipline, especially for young people, underlining that "philosophy is a discipline that encourages critical and independent thought and is capable of working towards a better understanding of the world and promoting tolerance and peace."


The 2015 keynote address will take place on the CCNY campus, on Thursday, 19th November, beginning at 6:30pm in the North Academic Building, room 0/201 (see here for directions and map). Students, faculty, and members of the public are invited and warmly encouraged to participate! A reception with the speaker will follow the talk. Join us for food and conversation with our keynote speaker!

</a>The 2015 WPD speaker will be <a href="http://www.princeton.edu/~psinger/">Peter Singer (Princeton University). Peter is an Australian moral philosopher. He is currently the Ira W. DeCamp Professor of Bioethics at Princeton University, and a Laureate Professor at the Centre for Applied Philosophy and Public Ethics at the University of Melbourne. He specializes in applied ethics and approaches ethical issues from a secular, utilitarian perspective. 

He is known in particular for his book, Animal Liberation (1975), a canonical text in animal rights/liberation theory. For most of his career, he supported preference utilitarianism, but in his later years became a classical or hedonistic utilitarian, when co-authoring The Point of View of the Universe with Katarzyna de Lazari-Radek. The title of Peter's keynote address will be: "The most good you can do: effectively aiding humans and other animals."


https://sites.google.com/site/philosophydayatccny/_/rsrc/1441904688189/keynote-speaker/petersingersmall2-0.jpg?height=112&width=200
results.how_to_find_us: North Academic Center (off Amsterdam, near 138th St.), room 0/201 in the basement
results.name: Second Annual Philosophy Day!

results.description:
Join us for a discussion based on the book In Search of Reality by Cecil A. Poole.

This week we will be discussing the topics from the Chapter 4: Some Applications Metaphysics.

You can download the free e-book here!

In reading this book, anyone interested in mysticism and spirituality will have a better idea of Rosicrucian philosophy.

Some of the topics to be covered include:

The Language of Metaphysics, The Meaning of Metaphysics, Metaphysics and Personal Evolvement, Some Applications of Metaphysics, Metaphysics and Religion, Metaphysics and the Psychic, Metaphysics and Practical Living, and Realization of Reality

All are Welcome!

results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com
results.how_to_find_us: Sign up at the front desk and they will direct you to the yoga room

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
Come out our last SingApplause! Session until March!!

Practice performing your songs at SingApplause!© This session gives you a chance to try out the music you’ve been working on in a safe, supportive and fun environment!

If you want try out a new song, brush up on an older one, present an original song or try out an entirely new style, SingApplause! is the place for you!

SingApplause! is simple, one person sings, everyone else applauds, and then the next person takes a turn, that’s it!

There’s no criticism, no coaching, no skills evaluation or any other negative commentary.  So whether you're a professional singer, amateur, wedding/event singer or songwriter - SingApplause! is for you!

If you are working on an aria, art song, spiritual, theater song, original song, jazz standard, whatever! - This session is for you!

We have a lot of fun in these sessions, so I hope you can make it and join in the fun!

Dr. Richard Duncan, Pianist (extraordinary pianist that can play just about any sheet music you give him!)

When: Thursday, November 19, 2015

Time: 6:45 – 9:00 PM
Cost: $15.00

Where: Yeoryia Studios
Othello Studio, 5th floor
2067 Broadway
(Between 71 - 72nd Streets)

*Please bring 3 - 5 songs that you would like to sing.

RSVP by Wednesday, November 18th.

All attendees sing! No auditors! Thanks.

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

And if you're coming right from work Vintage does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.



Vintage has been serving the White Plains community for many years.

It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!


****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table. Sometimes Panera Bread gets crowded so if you don't see the Meet-up sign on a table in the middle room, please look for us in the room to the right as you get off the stairs. I generally like a back table if I can get it. I will get there around 6:00 pm to get a table. 

Payment can be made in class.
results.how_to_find_us: Panera is near the corner of 33rd Street & 5th Ave. Closest subway is the F at 34th Street. Walk one block to 5th Ave. Turn right & walk down one block to 33rd. Street. We will be in the Cafe downstairs.

results.description:
NEW LOCATION!!! TO BE CONTINUED BOOKSTORE IN METUCHEN!!


Being an entrepreneur is like riding a never ending roller coaster – what do you do when it dips?

Join us for a conversation with Zion Kim, co-founder of 99robots.com, organizer of All Things Marketing, and founding member of Juice Tank, as he shares the raw lessons he’s learned along his incredible entrepreneurial journey.

Sam Popp, founder of Teach + Learn, interviews Zion Kim about the importance of defining your own happiness, keeping perspective on hardship, and how he turned a startup into a 6 figure business in only 6 months.

Learn about Zion:

Zion is the Co-Founder and leads all the marketing and business development efforts at 99 Robots, a digital marketing agency that also maintains a library of 30 WordPress plugins. He started his first company in the custom apparel industry, and is a founding member of JuiceTank, a startup incubator and coworking space.  Zion has developed social media strategies for Dell and serves as an advisor to multiple early stage companies. He's given talks at Rutgers, Drew, and Syracuse University and was profiled in NJ Biz as a top leader in the state. 


----------------------------------------------------------------------

Who can attend?

Anyone with a passion for self-development and sharing themselves with the business community

What should I bring?

Business cards, a friend if you'd like, an open mind

How much does it cost?

It's free! So RSVP and we'll see you there!

Have your contact info or link sent to our group of 500+ members! Do a giveaway or sponsor our next event. Contact Sam at [masked] for more information.
results.name: Fun, Failure, and Finding Yourself in Business: In Conversation with Zion Kim

Speed dating is the fun new way for single men and women to meet.

At our speed dating event, we expect around 12 men and 12 women ages 20s & 30s. Each man and woman will go on a 5-minute mini date with each other.

Speed dating is a fun and pressure free way to meet singles in NY! Tickets are $25 if you RSVP on our Meetup group, of $40 at the door without an RSVP if space is available

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.name: Basketball Open Play- ASL Thursday A-B

results.description:
RSVP ONLY IF YOU SERIOUSLY PLAN TO ATTEND THE EVENT!!!


Rain or Shine:  Join us for a Peruvian / Colombian dinner in Sunnyside.  My goal will be to keep the food cost (excluding tax, tip and MF ) under $25 per person and fill your belly with yummy food.

1. SERIOUS RSVP ONLY!!! (seriously) 


2. Family Style Ordering:  We'll discuss/pick dishes to share and divide the food bill equally.  Drinks will be an individual expense.

3. RSVP changes within 24 hours of the event will be treated as a NO SHOW.  See NO SHOW policy in the "About us..." section.


4. CASH only.

5. Meetup Fee: $2.00 (no fee if less than 10 members)

***Please advise me of any dietary restrictions or preferences prior to the event. 


Subway Station(s): 7 to the 46th Street Station 

Reservations will be under Dennis.  If you have any questions, feel free to txt Dennis (include your name) at[masked]

results.description:
We’ve heard it said before that “Healing comes from within”. 

Could you heal yourself and others with just your mind or a touch or a prayer? 

Absolutely!

Learn the powers that lie within each of us to help heal another. 

Saba, a practitioner of hypnosis and biofeedback, will teach you how to heal with your hands and words. Learn to feel stress and pain through the body. With the proper linguistics, a connection to the unconscious mind can be achieved. 

In this workshop you will learn to dispel the number one health enemy, “Stress” and heal the wounds through touch and language.

Visit SelfEmpoweredMinds.com

results.description:
After a successful first meetup, we will be hosting our second event on Thursday, November 19 in our offices.  The event will start at 7:00 P.M. and end at 9:00 P.M.  For more information on Wall Street Share, please visit our website at www.wallstreetshare.com.

Our belief is that there are a plethora of private companies attaining significant traction and possessing significant potential that are unable to access the strategic and investor relationships, capital, and other resources that they need to take their businesses to the next level.  Our event on November 19 will revolve around having such companies meet in our office space (16 East 40th Street, Suite 802) to discuss their businesses and needs in an intimate setting.  We anticipate that it will be not only a great opportunity to learn from others and network but also a good opportunity for you to meet our staff and explore a relationship with Wall Street Share to attain the resources you are seeking.

We will provide complimentary snacks and beverages.  We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Wall Street Share Meetup for Companies Seeking Investor Relationships & Capital

By the end of the Meetup we will have created their mobile app (IOS, Android and Windows phone versions) as well as their website.  

Those of you who are coming prepared with a well though out idea should message me so I can provide a list of relevant data you should have handy to insure that everything is set up correctly.

results.description:
By a slim margin, we'll be reading Ancillary Justice by Ann Leckie in November. This will be a really fun book to discuss, I think.

From Goodreads: "On a remote, icy planet, the soldier known as Breq is drawing closer to completing her quest. Once, she was the Justice of Toren - a colossal starship with an artificial intelligence linking thousands of soldiers in the service of the Radch, the empire that conquered the galaxy. Now, an act of treachery has ripped it all away, leaving her with one fragile human body, unanswered questions, and a burning desire for vengeance."

(after this, I think I will make the executive decision to hold off on sci-fi/spaceship books for a while!)
results.name: November Book Club - Ancillary Justice by Ann Leckie

results.description:
On Thursday, November 19th at 7:30pm, German International School New York will host an Information Evening at the German Consulate General of New York for prospective Manhattan parents whose children will enter pre-kindergarten (3s and 4s) and kindergarten (5s) in September 2016. 

The evening is an opportunity to meet the Head of School and Head of Lower School, speak with current parents and faculty members, and discover how your child can benefit from GISNY's academically exceptional pre-kindergarten to grade 12, bilingual, college preparatory program. 

GISNY welcomes families of all nationalities who are united by their interest in German language and German, Austrian and Swiss cultures and who recognize the distinct advantages of bilingualism and biliteracy in an increasingly competitive, interconnected world. 

There are no languages requirements for application to the Pre-Kindergarten and Kindergarten classes.


FREE EVENT: Please RSVP Here
results.name: German International School NY: Information Evening

results.description:
Going to Korea Town for Karaoke is something every true New Yorker needs to do............................. I'm told! 

Though I have lived here my whole life I have actually never done it- so I thought why not rent the biggest room at the famous Gagopa Karaoke and go with 29 of you girls!!
So I rented us a room for 3 HOURS!!  They offer wine and beer for purchase but also allow BYOB.. so I am going to bring a case of wine for us, which allows everyone to have at least 2 glasses.  

When you RSVP please tell me whether you tend to drink more RED or WHITE when you're out.  Also, if you know yourself to drink more than 2-3 glasses of wine to yourself (or if you prefer beer) it would be awesome if you would bring some too :)

Ok----- who's with me??!!!
Of course you do NOT have to sing if you come.   I probably won't????!!! gulp!!

also note-  in case you're wondering, between the wine i am purchasing and the percentage that meetup takes for payment transactions, this will be a financial loser for me.  i guess i'm counting on a couple of no-shows to fill the hole!!!  :)
results.how_to_find_us: Gagopa is on the 3rd Floor!!!!!
results.name: Karaoke Night in K-town!!

results.description:
We're delighted to have our old friend, Tom Santero, software engineer at Helium and current FOCO resident, presenting on Buridan's Principle, a paper by Turing Award-winner, Leslie Lamport.

Intro 

In 1984 Leslie Lamport began to observe the glitch problem [0] occurs in everyday life. Realizing this phenomenon had not been discussed by psychologists of the day, he set out to describe his observations using the classical formalization of Buridan's ass. Lamport initially failed to have this paper published in various scientific journals, being rejected on grounds of superficiality. It wasn't until 2011, when a reader suggested he resubmit to Foundations of Physics, that the paper was eventually published.

Those familiar with the works of Lamport know him as a logician, his life's work has pushed forward the state of the art in areas of mutual exclusion and distributed systems probably more than any other, and so reading Buridan's Principle might strike us as a bit odd, or even obscure. We're in unfamiliar territory with Lamport. Nonetheless, in this paper, Lamport's casual observations lead him to bridge the gap between the humanities and the sciences, providing us readers with what appears to be a universal law of nature: Buridan's Principle. 

[0] http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/lamport/pubs/glitch.pdf

Bio

</a><a href="http://tomasp.net">

Tom Santero (@tsantero) is a Software Engineer at Helium Systems, writing Haskell and Erlang to connect things to the internet. Previously, Tom worked at the New York Times on Search infrastructure, and before that he ran evangelism at Basho Technologies. A native New Yorker, Tom recently defected to Fort Collins, CO, where he lives with his two cats nearby an obnoxiously loud freight train. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------

TwoSigma - Platinum Sponsor of the New York chapter

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Details

Doors open at 7 pm; the presentation will begin at 7:30 pm; and, yes, there will be refreshments of all kinds and pizza. 

After Tom presents the paper, we will open up the floor to discussion and questions.  

We hope that you'll read the paper before the meetup, but don't stress if you can't. If you have any questions, thoughts, or related information, please visit #pwlnyc on slack, our GitHub repository, where you can also find the paper, or add to the discussion on this event's thread.

Additionally, if you have any papers you want to add to the repository above (papers that you love!), please send us a pull request. Also, if you have any ideas/questions about this meetup or the Papers-We-Love org, just open up an issue.

November's meetup is sponsored by
results.how_to_find_us: Tumblr's office is located between 5th Avenue and Park Avenue South on 21st Street. We're on the Ground Floor.
results.name: Tom Santero on Leslie Lamport's Buridan’s Principle

results.description:
The Product Group is proud to announce The Product Person Holiday Party 2015!


Join us in the West Village as we celebrate the Holiday season and a great year of Product!  In our 6th year of The Product Group -- enjoy the drinks, make new friends, have a great, laid-back time!


• Share!
Networking and Socializing w/ Fellow Product People

• Drink! 
FREE Wine & Beer (provided by Yext)

• Enjoy!
Music (provided by Lynn Stabile)

Get to know your fellow Product People better in this year's social event! (Not your regularly scheduled roundtable discussion. )

Don't forget, you must be a member & RSVP to get in.  See you there!


About Yext (DRINKS SPONSOR)
Yext is the global Digital Location Management (DLM) leader, helping over 500,000 business locations reach mobile consumers across a network of 100+ app, map, directory, search engine, and social media partners including Apple, Bing, Facebook, Foursquare, Yahoo, and Yelp. 

Yext's mission is to enable the world's 50 million businesses to tap into the power of location and drive face-to-face and digital interactions that boost customer engagement, build audiences, and increase sales through three core products—PowerListings®, Pages, and Xone™. 

Based in the heart of New York City with a growing team of over 400 employees worldwide, Yext has been recognized as one of America’s fastest growing companies by the Inc. 500 (#212 in 2015), one of Forbes Most Promising Companies (2014 & 2015) and one of Fortune's Best Places to Work (2014).


About Lynn Stabile (MUSIC SPONSOR)
Lynn Stabile is a user experience consultant providing UX analysis, reporting and improvement strategy for desktop and mobile websites and applications. Talk to her about evaluating and optimizing the usability of your product. Visit lynnstabile.com for more info.
results.name: The Product Person Holiday Party 2015!

We’ve heard it said before that “Healing comes from within”.

Could you heal yourself and others with just your mind or a touch or a prayer? 

Absolutely!

Learn the powers that lie within each of us to help heal another. 

Saba, a practitioner of hypnosis and biofeedback, will teach you how to heal with your hands and words. Learn to feel stress and pain through the body. With the proper linguistics, a connection to the unconscious mind can be achieved. 

In this workshop you will learn to dispel the number one health enemy, “Stress” and heal the wounds through touch and language.

Visit SelfEmpoweredMinds.com

results.description:
Everyone,

It's been awhile since I put together a meetup for anyone in the Westchester Area to attend. Sorry for my negligence.


There is small and nice venue for all of us to meetup for wining and light dining. There are a variety of many different kinds of wine and they're food is awesome! The portions of food is a size of an appetizer plate you may get a TGI Friday's or Apple Bees. I am cool with a young manager who runs the wine bar. The people who work there are really nice and attentive. So for those you who enjoy the taste of wine this is a nice place to visit. You have the option to get a single glass or 3 wine glasses to taste small amount of their different wines. Look forward to meeting anyone available to come out!

results.description:
VIBBY - Ari Cohen

Vibby is a fast-growing video platform that enables users to highlight, share and discuss the best parts of any online video, thereby making content more engaging, as well as providing invaluable analytics on user interaction at a very granular level. 

TREMORVIDEO - David Waldman

Tremor Video helps make every advertising moment more relevant for consumers. The company’s heritage as custodians of the most recognized advertiser and publisher brands is built on leadership in all-screen analytics and a long-standing commitment to transparency. 

VYDIA - Roy LaManna

Vydia has partnered with the biggest outlets in the world, like VEVO, YouTube, Dailymotion, and MUZU to bring artists the best rates for streaming music videos. With their analytics dashboard, you can easily see how much you’re earning and segment it by location and device. Create a VEVO channel and set up content ID in minutes with one easy to use platform.

MOMCAVETV - Jennifer Weedon Palazzo

Finding mom friends is HARD. Sometimes it feels like high school all over again! MomCave is a network of snarky comedies for moms. Their shows have been selected for (and won!) several film festivals. Their live show, MomCave LIVE was nominated for an IAWTV award for Best Live Series. 

DREAMITREEL - Tommy Travaglia 

How does DreamItReel work? It’s simple! All you have to do is upload your raw footage, tell them what you’re looking for, and select a video package. From there their world-class editors take over and shape your content into a unique, beautifully crafted video. Their difference is that they only accept the highest qualified editors to join our community. After months of screening, they assembled a highly curated community of video experts from all over the world that are passionate about creating videos that engage viewers and tell a story. No matter your video needs, they have the professionals to make it happen. Guaranteed. 

**Event Details: 


Columbia University - William and June Warren Hall

Amsterdam Ave. at 115th St.
Room 207 (Second floor)


                       7:00-7:30 PM Networking 

                       7:30-8:30 PM Presentations 

                       8:00-8:15 PM Networking 

NY Video Meetup Sponsors:  HBO, Waywire.com & Columbia University

*Food and drinks will be provided*
results.name: November NY Video Meetup

results.description:
[Let's try this again...]

First, a hearty welcome to John, who I met recently at the Uncommons' Fellowship event! A good time was had by all, even as we got systematically choked by locations, then by enemies, on the new quest (which is called Murder at the Prancing-Pony, in case you were wondering about this Meetup's title). Is there any other game where losing is so fun?

There's been some interest in trying it again, so though it's a bit shorter notice than usual, I'd like to try for this Thursday. If I need to sell it to those who didn't already see it, well, it'll probably be months until the quest hits retail... This is your chance to be ahead of the curve!
results.name: Murder at the Uncommons

results.description:
What's keeping you frozen, unable to move forward, and preventing you from becoming the best and highest version of yourself, and living the life you've been dreaming of? 

2016 is fast approaching, and you can make it your best year ever!

*This will be the last Self-Love & Happiness Club Meetup in 2015, so do your best to come.


This Meetup will be in 2 parts: 30 minutes of discussion followed by 60 minutes of coaching demonstrations and practice. 

In Part 1 of this 90-minute Meetup, we'll spend the first part in a lively and heart-felt discussion on what kinds of challenges you're currently facing in your life. Where have you wanted to move forward but haven't yet figured out how? What have you tried? You'll get to hear what challenges other Self-Lovers have and what they've tried? (You'll see how you're not alone; many of us face similar challenges.) 

After our exploration of the ways we're being held back from the lives we want to live, in Part 2 of our Meetup, if you've ever been curious about the coaching process and want to experience (or simply observe*) how powerful it can be, then this is the Meetup for you.

*Participation is purely voluntary. You're more than welcome to simply observe (you'll get a lot out of that, as well). 

I will ask for volunteers and we will do brief one-on-one coaching sessions to help you dig deep within yourself, uncover the hidden blocks, and tapping into your own Inner Wisdom, come away with the next step to move you forward. 

Then, if there's time, we'll get into pairs (again, only if you choose to, otherwise you can observe the pairs), and I will supply you with a few empowering questions and you can practice coaching each other (the added benefit is that you'll also come away with some knowledge on how to powerfully coach yourself).

Come prepared to take some positive and concrete steps towards making 2016 the best year ever. Remember, this will be the last Meetup in 2015. I'm looking forward to seeing you there!

COST: $10 (Please understand that it will cost me over $80 to do this Meetup - between Meetup.com fees and venue rental, so I must charge.)
results.name: Empower Yourself NOW, Get Unstuck, and Make 2016 Amazing

group.name: The Self Love and Happiness Club

Trumpets has a full service bar and serves food. Part of the menu is on www.trumpetsjazz.com

About The Venue: Trumpets first opened in 1985 and it soon became one of the the best Jazz venues in the state of NJ. The best musicians in the world performed at Trumpets: Gato Barbieri, Wynton Marsalis, and Dave Valentin, to name a few.

About The Musician: Born In Philadelphia, Dre Barnes began Piano studies at the age of 10. He started his musical journey playing the music of Bach, Beethoven, and Brahms. He also gained more musical experience playing at Church and with local R&B Groups.

In 2008 Barnes recorded his debut CD entitled “Wandering Spirits”. He has been a featured performer at Dizzy’s Club Coca Cola, Jazz at Lincoln Center as well as leading groups in the Trio/Quartet format in the NY/Tri-State Area.

Prepare yourself to be amazed by what a group of women and gay men can do. Lionesses hunt in packs. When they do, they rarely fail at catching their prey. This is exactly why the myth that women can't work together was perpetuated, because women working together literally become a force of nature. Join us for this event where you'll network with other single women and gay men who can help you find that special guy. You already know all too well that we need each other in this big city. Dating in New York City isn't like dating anywhere else, it takes a special kind of resolve to keep meeting men.

We'll form your hunting packs by neighborhood and borough, so you can keep each other motivated and we'll have a riveting talk led by our gay best friend and organizer on how to meet men. There will be a $10 fee to pay for venue space you can pay at the door which also comes with unlimited e-mail support with all your guy questions, so come and join us!

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
Presentation Title  - Microservices Architecture for MEAN Apps using Serverless Environments from AWS Description - Digital platforms are by nature resource intensive, expensive to build, and difficult to manage at scale. What if we can change this perception and help MEAN developers architect a digital platform that is low cost and low maintenance? This session describes the underlying architecture behind <a>www.deep.mg,</a> the microservices marketplace built by Mitoc Group and powered by AWS abstracted services like AWS Lambda, Amazon CloudFront, and Amazon DynamoDB. Eugene Istrati, the CTO of Mitoc Group, will dive deep into their approach to microservices architecture on serverless environments and demonstrate how anyone can architect AWS abstracted services to achieve high scalability, high availability, and high performance without huge efforts or expensive resources allocation. 

Presenter - Eugene Istrati has spent over 15 years as a technologist in a variety of industries, including digital media, cloud computing, and reputation marketing. His understanding of business needs is combined with his passion and awareness of new technology trends. Mr. Istrati holds a dual Bachelor of Science degree in Mathematics and Computer Science and a Master of Science degree in Computer Science and Engineering. 

Company - Mitoc Group is a web development studio that focuses on enterprise applications and platforms. Our mission is to enable businesses and developers to provide high-value products and services in a constantly changing digital world. Mitoc Group is also the creator of Digital Enterprise End-to-end Platform (also known as DEEP). DEEP is low cost and low maintenance Platform-as-a-Service powered by abstracted services (also known as serverless environments) from AWS.

results.description:
The winner of the "What to Read in November" poll was The Fifth Season by Brooklyn's own N.K. Jemisin.

Here's the publisher's blurb: "This is the way the world ends. Again.

Three terrible things happen in a single day. Essun, a woman living an ordinary life in a small town, comes home to find that her husband has brutally murdered their son and kidnapped their daughter. Meanwhile, mighty Sanze -- the world-spanning empire whose innovations have been civilization's bedrock for a thousand years -- collapses as most of its citizens are murdered to serve a madman's vengeance. And worst of all, across the heart of the vast continent known as the Stillness, a great red rift has been torn into the heart of the earth, spewing ash enough to darken the sky for years. Or centuries.

Now Essun must pursue the wreckage of her family through a deadly, dying land. Without sunlight, clean water, or arable land, and with limited stockpiles of supplies, there will be war all across the Stillness: a battle royale of nations not for power or territory, but simply for the basic resources necessary to get through the long dark night. Essun does not care if the world falls apart around her. She'll break it herself, if she must, to save her daughter."

I moved the meeting up a week due to the Thanksgiving holiday. If you'd like to suggest a place to meet in Ditmas Park/Prospect Park/Crown Heights or an adjacent area, just let me know! Otherwise I will choose one closer to the meeting date.

results.name: Book Discussion: The Fifth Season, by N.K. Jemisin

results.description:
So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.
results.name: 3D Thursday

About Enviromental Green Drinks Gatherings

Environmental Green Drinks is an informal monthly get-together for people interested in green living, sustainable business and building communities that are safe for living, biking, walking and growing food. We meet at places where the food is excellent and the prices are good.

Green Drinks are open, admission is free and new faces are always welcome, so come and join us some evening!

Acerca de las Reuniones Green Drinks

Green Drinks es un informal evento social para gente interesada en la sostenibilidad y el medio ambiente. Las reuniones facilitan el intercambio informal de ideas y estrategias "verdes" y colaboraciones comunitarias e individuales. Conversamos sobre alternativos fuentes de energía limpia, producción agrícola urbana, la comida natural y orgánica, comprar local, los empleos verdes. . . y la justicia ambiental. Nuestros encuentros están abiertos a la comunidad y todos encontrarán una calurosa bienvenida.

Os Eventos Green Drinks

Green Drinks é um evento social informal para dialogar sobre o estabelecimento duma sociedade sustentável, justa e no qual os comerciantes e indivíduos respeitam os recursos da terra e seus habitantes. A comunidade está muito bem vinda!

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life

Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.

Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?

Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday November 19th,  2015  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE

results.description:
There's a powerful movement sweeping the globe and you may be part of it without even realizing it. We’re intertwined together for a purpose that’s bigger than ourselves. A coach once said, “We’re connected for a reason and that’s a commitment to creating a compassionate, just, sustainable, spiritually-awake world where everyone wins.”

There's real hope for humanity, the community, and the world, and it's coming from the rapidly growing field of serving and social entrepreneurship, which embraces a triple affect – people, planet, and profit. How can we serve and transform a family, community, and the planet, without disrupting our lives or financial resources. Profiting is growing in human connection, spiritually, financially, and in business. To gain a healthy profit you must be in the business of encouraging and transforming lives. If you're reading this, I'll bet you have a genuine desire to serve the greater good through the creative application of your skills and your passion. However, you can't manifest your full potential without making a good living. After all, if you're struggling financially, your work to serve others won't be sustainable. Join me on a live conference call on Thursday, November 19th to discuss how to serve others and profit at the same time. Let’s share our ideas in how to impact others and our own lives together. We will also share some opportunities on volunteering in the community.

Thank you for being a part of Gifts of Encouragement, A Global Movement to Transform the World through Encouragement.

Thursday, November 19th @ 7:30pm
Call into Conference Line (530)[masked] code[masked]#

All the Best,
Kaneen Morgan
President, Gifts of Encouragement
results.name: Impacting Lives Together

results.description:
Through the Woods by Emily Carroll 

Discover a terrifying world in the woods in this collection of five hauntingly beautiful graphic stories that includes the online webcomic sensation “His Face All Red,” in print for the first time.

Journey through the woods in this sinister, compellingly spooky collection that features four brand-new stories and one phenomenally popular tale in print for the first time. These are fairy tales gone seriously wrong, where you can travel to “Our Neighbor’s House”—though coming back might be a problem. Or find yourself a young bride in a house that holds a terrible secret in “A Lady’s Hands Are Cold.” You might try to figure out what is haunting “My Friend Janna,” or discover that your brother’s fiancée may not be what she seems in “The Nesting Place.” And of course you must revisit the horror of “His Face All Red,” the breakout webcomic hit that has been gorgeously translated to the printed page.

Already revered for her work online, award-winning comic creator Emily Carroll’s stunning visual style and impeccable pacing is on grand display in this entrancing anthology, her print debut.
results.name: NBCBC #42 Through the Woods by Emily Carroll

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Saturday, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.why: Writers develop their story telling skills through steady writing and constructive feedback delivered by their peers. This group is full of talented writers willing to give their time to help others develop their craft.

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
Jimmy is seen alone at his piano playing Bach. When he finishes, he sees a beautiful girl outside the window. He chases after her. This establishes Jimmy's nature. He is full of passion and can channel it in any number of directions. What will happen if he can't channel that passion? Jimmy's gangster father enlists his help in picking up payments. Simultaneously, Jimmy is practicing for a Carnegie Hall audition. The film, which barely has a plot, is an examination of Jimmy slowly becoming psychologically undone because of the pressures from both the outside world and his internal intensity. James Toback's script sets the audience up for Jimmy's instability. His institutionalized mother, his violent father, and his passionate nature all work together to create a portrait of a man slowly losing his grip. In addition to the beautifully structured script, Keitel is willing and capable of making viewers believe the character. In one early scene, Jimmy is sitting in a restaurant playing a radio very loudly. A man asks him to turn the noise down. Keitel, with a sinister smile on his face, explains to the man that the song is one of the most innovative rock songs of all time. Jimmy is brimming with the desire to deck the man. Keitel captures the fervent, violent, and tumultuous inner life of the character. Toback utilizes many of the same filmmaking techniques Martin Scorsese applied in his earliest work. The prominent use of popular music, the shot-on-location New York settings, and the display of low-level gangsters' everyday lives are reminiscent of both Who's That Knocking at My Door? and Mean Streets, both films in which Keitel stars. While certainly paying tribute to Scorsese,Toback has a purpose to his style beyond simple homage. By putting viewers in this violent, realistic, un-Hollywood location, Jimmy's madness becomes palpable. The world of the film affects the character and the audience in equal measure, making the audience identify all the more with the disturbing aspects of Jimmy's inner life. It is worth noting that Toback gave the disturbed lead character in his directorial debut the same first name as himself.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jr9HymWe19g


This, like all Deuce screenings will sell out, get your tix here:

http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/movie/fingers/

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

BUT I’M A CHEERLEADER!
Thursday, November 19th @9:30PM
Videology Bar and Cinema
308 Bedford Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11249
[masked]

What happens when you’re a vegetarian and love Melissa Ethridge? Hate to break it to you, but you’re probably a lesbian. Time for an intervention!

Join The MUFF Society on November 19 for a screening of BUT I’M A CHEERLEADER! Everyone’s favorite OITNB character, Natasha Lyonne, teams up with director Jamie Babbit for her first feature film that deconstructs sexual identity, heteronormativity and gender roles. As usual, MUFF Society will be showcasing a local short film, giving away film-themed prizes and freebies, and they’ll even have a cheer-inspired photobooth.

Stay tuned for more announcements coming up as the MUFF date gets closer! 1,2,3,4, I won’t take no anymore!

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
Organized by Cosentino, Cosella-Dorken, and Roxul

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE - 

Tickets limited to the first 60 attendees.  Tickets will not be sold at the door. 

Only $10 for NYPH Members! Become a Member 

Breakfast & Lunch Included

All proceeds from ticket sales will go to Habitat for Humanity New York City

Event eligible for 3 CEU Credits


SCHEDULE

• 8:30 AM - Doors Open (Coffee & Pastries Provided)

• 9-12 PM - Speaker Discussion 

• 12-1 PM - Networking Lunch (Lunch Provided)

OVERVIEW

The design and construction of high performance buildings, driven by Passive House, LEED and other energy efficient building programs is becoming increasingly popular across North America. As a result, the construction industry is starting to see many new and innovative building enclosures being incorporated into all building types ranging from single family homes all the way up to taller wood-frame and non-combustible high-rise buildings. These more thermally efficient, air-tight, and durable building enclosure designs have evolved from existing North American practices with new materials that have been introduced into the market in recent years. Materials that include many new alternate: air barrier membranes, tapes & sealants, thermally efficient cladding supports, unique fasteners, and insulation products.


This half day seminar will provide an in depth overview of many of the new and innovative building enclosure designs that are being designed and constructed in North America with a focus on more thermally efficient, durable and air-tight walls and roofs. New and cutting edge research will be presented on the evaluation of exterior insulation cladding supports to minimize thermal bridging along with the tested real-world performance of various new air barrier systems. This seminar will provide insight as to where these new building enclosure components and assemblies work best along with the limitations of certain products, so you will understand how to best incorporate them on your next project.

Numerous case studies will be presented to demonstrate how new and innovative building enclosures have been integrated into various projects ranging from mid-rise wood-frame buildings, pre-fabricated passive houses, to towering wood, concrete and steel structures. 

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -


SPEAKER

Graham Finch, MASc, P.Eng, Principal, Building Science Research Specialist, RDH Building Science, Vancouver, BC, Canada

Graham is a Principal and Building Science Research Specialist with RDH Building Science. He has a passion for technology and for making better and more energy efficient buildings. He leads RDH’s building science research group and is actively involved in a wide range of projects from building research studies to forensic investigations, building monitoring, hygrothermal modeling, and new construction across North America. Graham has authored several publications and practical industry guideline documents related to durable and energy efficient building enclosures. In addition to RDH, Graham is a part-time instructor of Building Science at the British Columbia Institute of Technology.
results.name: High Performance Building Enclosures for Larger & Taller Buildings in N. America

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change
