results.description:
Hello Friends!

This week we are being graced by the presence of Katie Frankel (ffVC)!!

Katie Frankel joined ff Venture Capital in March of 2010, and serves as ffVC's Director of Community. In this role, Katie is responsible for facilitating relationships among the ffVC portfolio community, along with also overseeing the firm's social media, special events, and ad-hoc projects.

Prior to joining ffVC, Katie worked at Quigo Technologies, AOL, and founded The Trifecta Platform. Katie holds a BA in History from Quinnipiac University.

Little known fact: She was listed in Business Insider's 2014 list of rising VC Stars in NYC 30 under 30

We'll get a chance to hear about all her journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

09:30 to 09:50 Networking

10:10 to 11:00 Current Business Methods

Steve Navazio

We’ll have our own room for developers looking to work on their games and Jesse Freeman, Amazon Game Developer Evangelist, will be on site from 10am – 3pm to also help you with any questions you have about making games and publishing to the Amazon Appstore.

You'll need to do the following in order to attend:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for this event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

2020Shift is a social enterprise that’s focused on educating minorities on careers within digital media and technology. We are partnering with Uncubed to produce a tech crawl called OfficeHack. The event will give underrepresented millennials (18-34) the chance to see the inside of their favorite tech companies and startups. Participants will get a chance to network with industry professionals and get behind the scenes access to different office spaces and job /internship opportunities.

So far we have companies like AppNexus, LinkedIn, Mashable, and Yelp on board and we would love to get BIT involved!

Here is the link for people to RSVP: https://officehack.splashthat.com/

results.description:
Gameacon stands for Game Arts Conference. It is a festival created to help artists in game creation to thrive by providing a space for them to showcase new work and give them to the ability to reach an audience who craves to see their work. There are other festivals, but they are corporate, in big cities, and far away where it is expensive to stay, eat and get around. This festival is grass roots so as to foster those independent, risk-takers who will be the new voices in game creation. It will allow fans to experience new games, interact and learn from their creators, to meet others who share their passion for gaming; and to celebrate the creativity and artistry that goes into development by awarding the most awesome game creators of 2015. Of course, no gaming festival would be complete without tournaments, hangout rooms, board games and awesome cosplay parties.

Please purchase your event passes using the link below.
http://gameacon.com/buy-event-passes.html

Discounted Rooms for the event at Tropicana
Click here to book a discounted room.
results.name: Gameacon -  Game Arts Conference

Please put in the comments section below what time you will get here, after you RSVP.

Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath.

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program.


When: Fridays at 1pm. Please
arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Walk-and-Eat in a West Greenwich Village Tour made popular for its authentic bohemian history. You will find famous places where celebrities of 20th century liked to come for a cup of coffee and chat with friends and acquaintances. These places still exist and are open to all and every visitor who comes to the Village. Woody Allen, Andy Warhol, Valery Solanas, John Tyler, Jackson Pollock, Eugene O`Neill, Charlie Chaplin, Gregory Corso, Bob Dylan, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Allen Ginsberg, LeRoi Jones, Jack Kerouac,Ray Bremser, Jimi Hendrix, Bruce Springsteen, The Velvet Underground, Cat Mother & the All Night Newsboys, Kool and the Gang, Peter, Paul & Mary,  Lenny Bruce, Joan Rivers and many more- feel like a part of New York Bohemia. There is no other place like New York. This tour will include the sample of authentic New York style food such as pizza, falafel, riceballs and more. (only for a  group of no less than 10 people)

Washington Square

New York University

New York Authentic Food

Musicians memorable places

"Friends" Building

"Stonewall Inn" Riot and more

This tour takes approximately two hours and is easily accessible for baby strollers and wheelchairs. 

The cost for this event is only $10

results.description:
2015 is almost over!  Did your accomplish what you set out to do this year?  Do you need to recharge and refocus for 2016?  Let's get together and brainstorm and exchange resources to get us closer to where we want to be in doing what we love to do.  

The Disciplined Actor is a group of goal oriented, disciplined Actors out to get great work, achieve reputable credits, and make more money. It's a place to bring your big goals, to get work done on castings, resumes, websites, etc, receive support and/or feedback on your goals and progress week to week. This is a group for actors who want to be in a new spot in 6 months to a year from now in their careers and who would like structure, support, inspiration, and an environment to get the work done in order to achieve success.


$5 -$10 is a suggested donation to help fund the meetup but your attendance and bright ideas are most appreciated
results.name: 2015 Monthly Goals, Aspirations, and Strategies

results.description:
BROOKLYN BASKET BRIGADE 2015 IS UNDERWAY

November 20-21:  Keep these days open in your calendar to serve and make a profound difference for those struggling this holiday season.  The main day of course is Saturday, November 21st @ 9am where we assemble and deliver to the families.

If you haven't yet donated, you can do so easily at our website at:

===>>>    http://www.nycbasketbrigade.com/donate-now/  <<<===

and Donate to help us feed families in need in the NYC 5 boroughs.

In 2014, we helped feed 275 families in need which was more than 1100. In 2013, we fed more than 600 people.  In 2012, we helped feed more than 800 people, including many who were newly homeless in Staten Island and the Rockaways because of Hurricane Sandy.  We also helped shelters for families in crisis in the Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, Manhattan and Westchester.  Please help us serve even more families this year!


Please also join and share the public event on facebook:  

https://www.facebook.com/events/1644585372496227/

MORE DETAILS BELOW!

Greetings friends!


Your unique skills and talents are the greatest gift you can offer to show people strangers care, and can and will help feed hundreds of families this Thanksgiving! 

I know many of you expressed interest in helping the NYC Basket Brigade last year, and for some, after Hurricane Sandy in 2012, it was a little late. Since I am lead organizer for the NYC Basket Brigade this year, you have the perfect chance to try something new, NOT procrastinate ;-)  and be a part of this amazing volunteer effort on Nov 20th and 21st in advance! Here are some roles we have open for people to step up and fill so we feed as many families as we can this year. 

Social Media

Fund Raising

Logistics

Public Relations

Video Editing

Marketing

Event Planning

Remember it's not about having the perfect amount of, time, money, or energy to offer. It's about doing ANYTHING you can to help, creating focus, being resourceful, and BELIEVING any little action you take to do something, means something, and makes a difference! Also for those of you going out of town, many of these actions you could even do remotely from anywhere in the world as we approach Nov 20th-21st! 

Please reply to this email, if any of the roles pique your interest, also feel free to post the flyers (http://www.nycbasketbrigade.com/s/FINAL-BB-Flyer-2015-Brooklyn-Queens-hg4x.pdf) in your workplace or neighborhood, and forward this message to friends, family, and community wanting to have a memorable experience of unique growth and contribution this Holiday Season! 


With much gratitude!

Frank Clark


Anna Olivo

Seamus Behan

David Block

Albert Wu

Jennifer Wilkov

Amanda Scocozzo

Joseph Varghese

If you can’t feed a hundred people, feed just one.  

~Mother Teresa

"Why should there be hunger and deprivation in any land, 
in any city, at any table, when man has the resources and the 
scientific know-how to provide all mankind with the basic 
necessities of life? There is no deficit in human resources. 
The deficit is in human will." 
- Martin Luther King, Jr.

If you offer your compassion to the hungry 
And satisfy the famished creature 
Then shall your light 
Shine in darkness 
And your gloom 
Shall be like noonday 
-Isaiah 58:10

"There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear 
to them except in the form of bread." 
- Mohandas Gandhi

By RSVPing here, you are committing to show up at the Westchester/Hartsdale location on Saturday, November 21st.

DONATIONS ONLINE AT http://nycbasketbrigade.com/

** For all those volunteering, please indicate which date(s) you will attend - 20th or 21st or both!  Please also sign up at http://www.nycbasketbrigade.com/register-to-volunteer/  &


-> (1) Please indicate if you will be driving a car. 


-> (2) What city/borough do you live in personally? (We may be able to find delivery locations to the families in need on route back back to your home)

Our goal is to feed 500 families or more. Please help us spread the word on facebook, by email, linked in, word of mouth or go to our website and print out flyers for distribution.  

Volunteers can come from anywhere, not just this community - friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, soccer team, the gym, yoga class, that guy you always see on the train! Carry flyers with you if you can, or put them in public locations - churches, supermarkets, Grand Central, Penn Station and Port Authority! 

NYC Basket Brigade, Inc.
www.nycbasketbrigade.com 
What to be a Volunteer ??
Email: [masked]

Charity Coordinator - Identifies recipient families & verifies names/address/phone numbers and availability to receive basket (3-5 days in advance). 

Shopping Coordinator - Negotiates best pricing on basket ingredients, plans bulk purchase deals, pickup, loading of food items, transportation to prep site

Fund Raising Coordinator - Spearhead all fundraising efforts from individuals and families in the community, and   small direct donations per basket via word of mouth, networking & the web.

IT Coordinator - Helping with technical difficulties on website: www.nycbasketbrigade.com supporting our web developer, with social media connectivity, payment processes etc. 

Publicity/Media/Press Coordinator - Promotes event to media outlets (traditional) to get donations and volunteers. Call all local news outlets on the day of the event. 

Social Media Specialists (Facebook Specialist, Twitter Specialist, Instagram Specialist, LinkedIn Specialist, Youtube Specialists. Manages and updates all Web promo activity 

Photographer/Videographer - Capture this amazing event with real time photos, video, and then sort, select best photo, video pieces for the history books, edit a final montage after the event is over. 

Pedestrian Volunteers – Does not have a vehicle, helps assemble, delivers on foot, or rides with a driver.

Vehicle Volunteers (DRIVERS) – Has vehicle to drive and make deliveries to recipient family homes. (Anyone with large moving equipment, trucks, vans, welcome!)

Kids/Young Volunteers - DECORATION:  Crafts, Stickers, Markers, Ties, Bows etc. 

www.nycbasketbrigade.com 
What to be a Volunteer Email:  [masked]

results.name: Thanksgiving - NYC Basket Brigade - Brooklyn, NY (Brownsville)

results.description:
Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Another event for World cuisine tasting. Southern food is part of American cuisine, but it's totally different from what we are used to here in NY. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuisine_of_the_Southern_United_States
Real comfort food. The place I offer to go is Root & Bone cafe, they serve great southern food, but they elevate it to good restaurant quality. http://rootnbone.com/
Southern staples like shrimp and grits or fried chicken and waffles. Great desserts with local seasonal ingredients.

I made reservation for 2 tables for 5:30 and for 6. Please confirm you are coming so I can adjust# or move time. It's small restaurant, so they are tight with reservations.
results.name: Let's taste Southern food

results.description:
National Geographic photographer Steve McCurry is recognized universally as one of today's finest image-makers, is best known for his evocative color photography. In the finest documentary tradition, McCurry captures the essence of human struggle and joy.
Join us at the Rubin Museum to see this important body of work by McCurry. The museum is free on Friday nights so keeping with our cheap is good, free is better mantra, we’ll meet there Friday evening November 20th at 5:30. We’ll spend an hour at the very hip K2 Lounge in the museum’s lobby in order to allow for travel time, then we’ll head upstairs to the exhibit.
Here’s the link:
http://rubinmuseum.org/events/exhibitions/steve-mccurry-india
Here’s the story:
Steve McCurry: India, co-organized by the Rubin Museum and the International Center of Photography, brings together stunning photographs of India—its people, monuments, landscapes, seasons, and cities—by the renowned photographer Steve McCurry. The exhibition, which is representative of three decades of McCurry’s work, is the first museum presentation to focus on his India photographs and includes some that have never been shown before.
A combination of portraits, landscapes, and documentary imagery express McCurry’s curiosity and commitment to capturing unexpected moments. The exhibition opens with images of spiritual life, as well as selections from the series India by Rail, which portray the movement and life surrounding the Indian Railway. Photographs from the Monsoon series depict India’s season of heavy storms that is also synonymous with life, passion, and celebration. Later works capture beautiful landscapes, historical sites, and the life of ordinary people in major cities and rural areas, representative of diverse regions of India. Objects from the Rubin Museum collection of Himalayan art will be thoughtfully selected to complement the photographs on view and to illustrate the connections between ancient and contemporary India.
results.name: Steve McCurry: India Photography at the Rubin Museum

results.description:
Back in 1996, we were excited when we could only find a product in a web store, put it into the cart and have it delivered to our doorsteps. A few years forward, customer reviews and social sharing features made shopping already a lot more fun. Entering the Web 3.0 era, commerce is increasingly melting with content, community and context to create never seen before personal shopping experiences.

With the help of new technology, merchants and brands can analyze their customers’ characteristics and behaviours to engage with them within the context of their needs, desires, preferences, timing and location, to surprise and delight them and build long-lasting customer relationships.

The upcoming ecomhack New York is all about how smartphones, wearables, beacons and other emerging devices enable creating these personal experiences that make shopping more individual, more efficient – and more fun.
results.name: ecomhack New York: Personal Commerce

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
Come join the REVOLUTION with the NY Sci-Fi and Fantasy Group for the final chapter of the Hunger Games Saga:                                         Mockingjay Part 2! 

No better way to see this than in visually stunning IMAX 3D...


Schedule: 

6pm - We will be meeting at Luce's Restaurant and Bar for drinks and to mingle before the show. 

*Since this is theater with assigned seats, no need to rush to save seats! Best available seats were selected with a great view of the massive IMAX screen.

7pm - Head to the movie Theater

7:15pm - Showtime! 

9:30pm - After Show chat and drinks

Logistics:

A block of seats have already been reserved for our group at the AMC Loews Lincoln IMAX theater on Broadway and W. 68th.

Since these tickets have already been purchased, the first 14 members that pre-pay for their tickets via Paypal are guaranteed a seat. 

If there are any available tickets by Thursday, November 19th, waitlisted members will be invited to purchase remaining tickets via the link below. If there are STILL tickets remaining by Friday, Nov. 20th, cash will be accepted at the 6:00pm meetup restaurant. Once this is full, other members can still join us by purchasing tickets to the show directly from the movie theater or on Fandango (subject to availability). 

Please be advised that this showtime will likely sell out in advance.

Seats for the NY Sci-fi & Fantasy block can be reserved by first RSVPing through Meetup and then paying for the tickets at: 

https://www.paypal.me/RichXbox/21

Please do not check the goods/services box as it will incur extra fees. If you end up on the waitlist, please wait until your attendance can be confirmed before sending money by the link.

Post-movie gathering: 

We'll congregate at the back exit of the IMAX theater near the windows overlooking the Apple Store. Once we're all gathered, those that want to join for a post-movie meetup will head out to a nearby bar.

Let's close this blockbuster movie franchise with a bang!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at 6pm at a Luce Restaurant's Bar near the theater (2014 Broadway between 68th and 69th) before the 7:15pm showtime for the movie.
results.name: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2 in IMAX 3D!

Later that night we will go to Monarch rooftop. There we will continue the party till 4am. We normally leave the first venue @10:15pm.

Cheers,

If you're interested in getting on stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

 All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!


https://www.facebook.com/events/479642925574801/

results.description:
Dear Group Members,

After a great summer and a small break from our monthly series ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’, I am very happy and honor to announce that our second edition of The Flame Festival is coming out next NOVEMBER 20TH – 22ND, 6pm- 7:30pm at Cornelia Street Café showcasing the unique work of some of the musicians whom has been part of our series. I want to take the time as well to thank you all for supporting the series by coming to our performances. 

The festival kicks off on NOVEMBER 20th with my own musical project, accompanied by Rebeca Vallejo's trio with George Dulin at the piano and David Silliman on the percussion/drums. On Saturday NOVEMBER 21st, the festival will showcase the original compositional style of the great Minneapolis guitar player Juanito Pascual; the festival will close on Sunday November 22nd with a performance by the quartet INFLAME. This eclectic musical combo brings together the language of Flamenco with the one of Classical Indian music.

November 20th – 22nd
6pm – 7.30 pm. Not to be missed!!!
$15 Cover + $10 Minimum
29 Cornelia Street, Greenwich Village, NY 10014

For reservations call Cornelia St Café IN ADVANCE at[masked] 19. When making reservations ask to speak with Jonathan. Because the venue is small and it gets really hectic, in order to help the venue's stuff be able to sit you all together, I suggest the group meets right outside the venue (or by the bar area) at 5:30 pm... It is not always guaranteed you will be able to sit in the same tables but I can guarantee you will always meet great people at these concerts and will enjoy great music :)


‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco. The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nvJez5VWmXg&feature=youtu.be&a=
results.name: ‘The Flame Festival 2015’ the First Jazz-Flamenco Festival in the U.S.

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
We are very pleased to host Professor Emanuel Derman, Columbia University.

Abstract: 


You can try to understand the world using data, intuition, models and theories. Raw data has no voice. It takes models, theories and intuition to make use of data. 

Models are metaphors that explain the world we don’t understand, in terms of worlds we do. They tell you only what something is more or less like. 

Theories are descriptions that try to tell you what something really is. 

It takes great intuition to discover a correct theory.


Emanuel is a professor at Columbia University, where he directs their program in financial engineering. He is the author of My Life As A Quant. His latest book is Models.Behaving.Badly: Why Confusing Illusion with Reality Can Lead to Disasters,On Wall Street and in Life.


He was born in South Africa but has lived most of his professional life in Manhattan in New York City, where he has made contributions to several fields. He started out as a theoretical physicist, doing research on unified theories of elementary particle interactions. He worked at AT&T Bell Laboratories in the 1980s. From 1985 to 2002 he worked on Wall Street, running quantitative strategies research groups in fixed income, equities and risk management, and was appointed a managing director at Goldman Sachs & Co. in 1997. The financial models he developed there, the Black-Derman-Toy interest rate model and the Derman-Kani local volatility model, have become widely used industry standards.

He has a B.Sc. from University of Cape Town in Physics, and a PhD in Theoretical Physics from Columbia University.

Here's the link to his blog: http://www.emanuelderman.com  and Twitter profile https://twitter.com/EmanuelDerman.
results.name: Data, Intuition, Models and Theories

results.description:
Entrepreneur and startup VIP Networking event for the Import Export Meetup.  This is an event for members of the Import Export Meetup to meet each other and make new business and personal contacts.

No admission fee for this event.

The event will go as follows:

6:00pm to 6:15pm - Members meet at Troy. (You must say you with the party of John Riggio at the entrance to be admitted.)

6:15pm to 6:45pm - Members will get a free VIP drink card with free appetizers. 

6:45pm to 7:45pm - Members can exchange business cards ( if you have one) .  Members can talk to each other within the group to make new contacts.


7:45pm - 11:30pm - You may stay at Troy for more networking.

You may order additional food and drinks on your own.

Doors 6PM

Simply say that you are with the party of JOHN RIGGIO at the door.

DRINK SPECIALS 6-9PM Guys Free til 11:30pm, Ladies Free ALL Night


Dress code is strictly enforced.


The Troy Liquor Bar is located at the corner of Hudson Street and West 13th Street.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the Bar and say you are with the party of "John Riggio" to the doorman to be admitted. Find us in reserved section.

results.description:
Dear Group Members,

After a great summer and a small break from our monthly series ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’, I am very happy and honor to announce that our second edition of The Flame Festival is coming out next NOVEMBER 20TH – 22ND, 6pm- 7:30pm at Cornelia Street Café showcasing the unique work of some of the musicians whom has been part of our series. I want to take the time as well to thank you all for supporting the series by coming to our performances.

The festival kicks off on NOVEMBER 20th with my own musical project, accompanied by my trio with George Dulin at the piano and David Silliman on the percussion/drums. November 20th
6pm – 7.30pm. Not to be missed!!!
$15 Cover + $10 Minimum
29 Cornelia Street, Greenwich Village, NY 10014

For reservations call Cornelia St Café IN ADVANCE at[masked] 19. When making reservations ask to speak with Jonathan. Because the venue is small and it gets really hectic, in order to help the venue's stuff be able to sit you all together, I suggest the group meets right outside the venue (or by the bar area) at 5:30 pm... It is not always guaranteed you will be able to sit in the same tables but I can guarantee you will always meet great people at these concerts and will enjoy great music :)

About Rebeca Vallejo

 La compositora y vocalista madrileña Rebeca Vallejo es una artista enormemente innovadora y versátil, conocida por combinar con el lenguaje del jazz sus raíces ncestrales de flamenco y su profunda pasión y conocimiento de la música brasileña, elementos que teje diestramente para 


producir un sonido único. El tercer álbum de estudio de Rebeca Vallejo es una colección de 8 composiciones originales, dos adaptaciones exclusivas de estándares de Jazz y una interpretación en forma de bulería del clásico de Milton Nascimento “Cravo e Canela”. El álbum ha visto la luz bajo la dirección del productor ganador de Grammy John Seymour (Santana, US, Dave Matthews Band). “Azúcar, Canela”, apunta más allá del mero entretenimiento para crear un viaje unificador donde convergen tres culturas musicales, tres países (España, Brasil, EE.UU), y tres tipos distintos de “blues”.

https://youtu.be/nvJez5VWmXg

‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco.

The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.
results.name: ‘The Flame Festival 2015’ with Rebeca Vallejo

results.description:
Holistic Hangout

(typically every 3rd Friday of the month)

Relax, Unwind, Refresh

When climbing the mountain of enlightenment, growth, self-development, healing, and spirituality it can be good to stop and catch your breath.

Share, Connect and Exchange!

Meet fellow seekers off the mat, outside the circle, beyond the classroom.

Rest your 3rd eye

Revive your Chakras

Fill your heart with good company, food and drink.


COME OUT & PLAY WITH US at the WHOLE FOODS CAFE!

Stop by for a little, Stop by for a lot,

Stop by on your way or Stop by and stay,

Stop by for some stimulating conversation and a bite to eat with unique and interesting people who share an interest in the diversity of holistic and alternative news, views and practices. We are experimenting with this new, quieter space with more freedom to mingle, move, chat and exchange.

This is a very casual event.  No agenda, just simple conversation, meet and mingle.

Share adventures, experiences, health tips, intentions and more

Learn about interesting classes

Meet healers, practitioners and coaches

 If you are just beginning to explore or been exploring for a while, we welcome you.  It is amazing how so many people who are attracted find that they have natural abilities of healing, coaching, energyworking or even more amazing skills.

Make Great Connections in an inviting social setting

We Look Forward To Welcoming Back Old Friends & Meeting New Ones Too!

You can Register here on Meetup or on EventBrite

Many Blessings,


Joel Elfman & Michael Balice


***We are often joined by members from several other Meetup groups this event is posted to.
results.how_to_find_us: we'll have some signs out among the upstairs tables
results.name: Holistic Hangout @Whole Foods Cafe - Houston St

Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk toward the back of the lobby, we'll be on the raised section on the left.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description:
WESTCHESTER BASKET BRIGADE 2015 IS UNDERWAY

November 20-21:  Keep these days open in your calendar to serve and make a profound difference for those struggling this holiday season. The main day of course is Saturday, November 21st @ 9am where we assemble and deliver to the families.

Please also check the website at:

===>>>    http://www.nycbasketbrigade.com/  <<<===

and Donate to help us feed families in need in the NYC 5 boroughs and Westchester.

In 2014, we helped feed 275 families in need which was more than 1100. In 2013, we fed more than 600 people.  In 2012, we helped feed more than 800 people, including many who were newly homeless in Staten Island and the Rockaways because of Hurricane Sandy.  We also helped shelters for families in crisis in the Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, Manhattan and Westchester.  


Our goal in 2015 is to serve 2000 + people in need.


MORE DETAILS BELOW!

Greetings friends!


Your unique skills and talents are the greatest gift you can offer to show people strangers care, and can and will help feed hundreds of families this Thanksgiving! As a reminder of what a few acts of kindness and words of inspiration can do for another person, I have attached a pdf copy of Anthony Robbins "Notes From A Friend" a very quick read, and truly inspiring!

I know many of you expressed interest in helping the NYC Basket Brigade last year, and for some, after Hurricane Sandy, it was a little late. Since I am lead organizer for the NYC Basket Brigade this year, you have the perfect chance to try something new, NOT procrastinate ;-)  and be a part of this amazing volunteer effort on Nov 20th and 21st in advance! Here are some roles we have open for people to step up and fill so we feed as many families as we can this year. 

Social Media

Fund Raising

Logistics

Public Relations

Video Editing

Marketing

Event Planning

Remember it's not about having the perfect amount of, time, money, or energy to offer. It's about doing ANYTHING you can to help, creating focus, being resourceful, and BELIEVING any little action you take to do something, means something, and makes a difference! Also for those of you going out of town, many of these actions you could even do remotely from anywhere in the world as we approach Nov 20th-21st! 

Please reply to this email, if any of the roles pique your interest, also feel free to post the flyers (http://www.nycbasketbrigade.com/flyer-2013-nyc-bb/) in your workplace or neighborhood, and forward this message to friends, family, and community wanting to have a memorable experience of unique growth and contribution this Holiday Season! 


With much gratitude!

Frank Clark


Anna Olivo

Seamus Behan

David Block

Sara Allen

Amanda Scocozzo

Joseph Varghese

Michael Ambrosino

If you can’t feed a hundred people, feed just one.  

~Mother Teresa

"Why should there be hunger and deprivation in any land, 
in any city, at any table, when man has the resources and the 
scientific know-how to provide all mankind with the basic 
necessities of life? There is no deficit in human resources. 
The deficit is in human will." 
- Martin Luther King, Jr.

If you offer your compassion to the hungry 
And satisfy the famished creature 
Then shall your light 
Shine in darkness 
And your gloom 
Shall be like noonday 
-Isaiah 58:10

"There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear 
to them except in the form of bread." 
- Mohandas Gandhi

By RSVPing here, you are committing to show up at the Westchester/Hartsdale location on Saturday, November 21st.

DONATIONS ONLINE AT http://nycbasketbrigade.com/

** For all those volunteering in Westchester this year.  Please indicate which date(s) you will attend - 20th or 21st or both!  Please register at http://www.nycbasketbrigade.com/register-to-volunteer/

-> (1) Please indicate if you will be driving a car. 

-> (2) What city/borough do you live in personally? (We may be able to find delivery locations to the families in need on route back back to your home)

Our goal is to feed 500 families or more. Please help us spread the word on facebook, by email, linked in, word of mouth or go to our website and print out flyers for distribution. 

Volunteers can come from anywhere, not just this community - friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, soccer team, the gym, yoga class, that guy you always see on the train! Carry flyers with you if you can, or put them in public locations - churches, supermarkets, Grand Central, Penn Station and Port Authority! 

NYC Basket Brigade, Inc.
www.nycbasketbrigade.com 
What to be a Volunteer ??
Email: [masked]

Charity Coordinator - Identifies recipient families & verifies names/address/phone numbers and availability to receive basket (3-5 days in advance). 

Shopping Coordinator - Negotiates best pricing on basket ingredients, plans bulk purchase deals, pickup, loading of food items, transportation to prep site

Fund Raising Coordinator - Spearhead all fundraising efforts from individuals and families in the community, and   small direct donations per basket via word of mouth, networking & the web.

IT Coordinator - Helping with technical difficulties on website: www.nycbasketbrigade.com supporting our web developer, with social media connectivity, payment processes etc. 

Publicity/Media/Press Coordinator - Promotes event to media outlets (traditional) to get donations and volunteers. Call all local news outlets on the day of the event. 

Social Media Specialists (Facebook Specialist, Twitter Specialist, Instagram Specialist, LinkedIn Specialist, Youtube Specialists. Manages and updates all Web promo activity 

Photographer/Videographer - Capture this amazing event with real time photos, video, and then sort, select best photo, video pieces for the history books, edit a final montage after the event is over. 

Pedestrian Volunteers – Does not have a vehicle, helps assemble, delivers on foot, or rides with a driver.

Vehicle Volunteers (DRIVERS) – Has vehicle to drive and make deliveries to recipient family homes. (Anyone with large moving equipment, trucks, vans, welcome!)

Kids/Young Volunteers - DECORATION:  Crafts, Stickers, Markers, Ties, Bows etc. 

www.nycbasketbrigade.com 
What to be a Volunteer Email:  [masked]

results.description:
Let's go for a quick bite at Slyce in Ardsley on Friday November 20th starting at 6:00. They have great beer too - it's a small place so we'll limit this to SIX - your $3 will secure your spot. 


As the owners of Ardsley Pizza, Tony and Phil Ciccone were already known for making some of the best pizza in Westchester County. But they wanted to elevate their cuisine even further, which is why they transformed their business into Slyce, an eatery that serves what they like to call "GastroPizza." That means lovingly crafted, artisanal pies such as goat cheese, fig, and honey served alongside growlers of craft beer, including Brooklyn Brewery, Broken Bow Brewery, and Captain Lawrence.

Last month I had their amazing wild mushroom, garlic and truffle oil pizza - OMG this was the best pizza I have ever had -- and I have had a lot of pizza.  Great craft beers and wine specials are on tap! I want you to come check this place out !! Let's GO!!! 


check out their menu here: http://www.slyceny.com/v1/data/uploads/menu-052815.pdf


See you there!
results.name: Let's go to SLYCE In Ardsley for Great Pizza!

results.description:
“A bill of rights is what the people are entitled to against every government on earth”, declared Thomas Jefferson. Since the Cyrus Cylinder in 539 BCE, many efforts have been made to craft a bill of rights, perhaps the most influential being Magna Carta. Written 800 years ago, this document has been described as “the greatest constitutional document of all time”.

In this interactive seminar Allen Smith examines the extensive and enduring influence of Magna Carta, and explores the system of property rights that underpins our economic system. Allen critiques George Washington’s comment on the enactment of the Bill of Rights that “They have given the rights of man a full and fair discussion, and explained them in so clear and forcible manner as cannot fail to make a lasting impression.”
results.name: Liberty – the Enduring Struggle for Human Rights and Property Rights

group.name: Progress and Prosperity, Land and Liberty – New York City

results.description:
Dear Group Members,

After a great summer and a small break from our monthly series ‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’, I am very happy and honor to announce that our second edition of The Flame Festival is coming out next NOVEMBER 20TH – 22ND, 6pm- 7:30pm at Cornelia Street Café showcasing the unique work of some of the musicians whom has been part of our series. I want to take the time as well to thank you all for supporting the series by coming to our performances. 

The festival kicks off on NOVEMBER 20th with my own musical project, accompanied by Rebeca Vallejo's trio with George Dulin at the piano and David Silliman on the percussion/drums. On Saturday NOVEMBER 21st, the festival will showcase the original compositional style of the great Minneapolis guitar player Juanito Pascual; the festival will close on Sunday November 22nd with a performance by the quartet INFLAME. This eclectic musical combo brings together the language of Flamenco with the one of Classical Indian music.

November 20th – 22nd
6pm – 7.30 pm. Not to be missed!!!
$15 Cover + $10 Minimum
29 Cornelia Street, Greenwich Village, NY 10014

For reservations call Cornelia St Café IN ADVANCE at[masked] 19. When making reservations ask to speak with Jonathan. Because the venue is small and it gets really hectic, in order to help the venue's stuff be able to sit you all together, I suggest the group meets right outside the venue (or by the bar area) at 5:30 pm... It is not always guaranteed you will be able to sit in the same tables but I can guarantee you will always meet great people at these concerts and will enjoy great music :)


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nvJez5VWmXg&feature=youtu.be&a=

‘The Flame: Flamenco Infused Jazz’ is a series of jazz flamenco concerts that showcases the work of musicians whose artistic vision, although strongly based in Jazz sounds and approaches, latches onto the roots of Flamenco. The fusion of Flamenco with the flavors of the old and new continents not only preserves this genre, but also helps to take it further into the future.
results.name: ‘The Flame Festival 2015’ the First Jazz-Flamenco Festival in the U.S.

results.description:
Love art, hate art or just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because this event is more about socializing and having fun!  It is a great way to spend a Friday evening with dozens of other fun members and friends!

You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, take picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at The Old Castle Tavern for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).  At least One person in your group will need to have a camera.

Can I come alone?  YES! 95% of those attending will come on their own.  If you come alone we will randomly set you up on a team.

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle tavern for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

Her is how it works:  Arrive at Old Castle Tavern between 6pm-6:30pm, enjoy a cocktail and get set up on a team (if you already don't have one)  Once you have a complete team we will send you out to the museum to find all the clues.

What am I looking for at the museum?  All the clues are things that are already at the museum.  It is in the paintings, sculptures, gift shops, hallways, signs and the people that are there! Each team will have 75 minutes to find as many clues as possible.  The teams with the most points will win prizes.  Don't worry if you didn't answer all the items because there are bonus points.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time


Cost $15 general admission: Please bring exact change

What's included?
- Admission to MOMA
-Private reception with drink Specials at the bar
- A fun way to visit the museum
- A unique way to make friends

Hey Dave, get the conversation started!
results.name: MoMA Multi Group Scavenger Hunt

results.description:
Rodeo in November? Shoot! And why not? Isn't November Rodeo worthy?

This will be intermediate ride that will cover 18-22 miles at a leisurely pace. We'll start off with a lap of Central Park, then head down W55th to the Manhattan Greenway Path - smack dab on the Hudson. Yee-haw!

(ehem...)


We'll ride that sucker all the way down to the battery and back up the East River to the Williamsburg Bridge. After sidling our way up and over we'll reach our final destination - Viva Toro. 

This Tex-Mex gem has some killer food and drink including pineapple shots for the brave - and sarsaparilla for the rest of us. For the truly courageous - or silly - you can take a turn on the mechanical Bull (to the enjoyment of all)!


So giddyup partner - it's BromptonRodeo season - and you're invited!

Viva Toro: http://www.vivatoro.com
results.how_to_find_us: Come join us for
results.name: Brompton Rodeo Ride

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
Please register for the event here: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/understanding-basic-electronics-and-transistors-tickets-19460256150

Hey everyone, 

This month we will learn about transistors, what it does and how silicon plays a role. We will have our usual 30 minute lecture, follow by DIY activities. We will provide pizza and beverages. 

The workshop includes all the materials needed, including:


• Breadboard
• 9V Battery
• Transistors
• Resistors 
• Capacitors 
• Jumper wires
• IC Chip 
• LED 
• Worksheet 

The cost for this workshop is $25. It's quite difficult to manage the number of materials I need to prepare, so please register from the link above. Thank you!

We look forward to having you!
results.name: Understanding Transistors

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Hello Everyone -

We'd like to invite you to our NYC Friends of Clearwater monthly gathering! We hope you can join us at 239 Thompson Street on Friday, November 20th, starting at 6:30pm.

Our environmental speaker this month will be Murray Fisher, co-founder of the Billion Oyster Project and Executive Director of the New York Harbor Foundation. He will tell us about the work that is being done to bring oysters back to NYC's harbor. You can check out the website here: www.billionoysterproject.org

We'll also be having our club elections this evening, and nominations can be made just before the election takes place. Eligible members, this is your chance to become more involved in the inner workings of our group!

Then, in the "open mike" portion of the evening, we'll hear from our musicians. We want to make sure we have plenty of music, so please bring your instruments, your voices, and whatever you would like to share with us. A song? A poem? Or anything else that expresses your creativity - but please be ready to join in and sing!

The evening also features a potluck dinner. It's always interesting to see what kind of food selections people bring! Whether you love to prepare your favorite recipes, or you'd rather just bring something from a salad bar, this is your opportunity to share something delicious with us. A main course, veggies, juice or seltzer to drink are especially welcome! We would also like to encourage people to bring their own utensils and reusable dishes, but whatever you need will be there as well.

Our monthly gatherings take place at Judson Memorial Church, an organization which shares our vision of social and environmental justice, and activism through the arts. The location is 239 Thompson Street, just south of Washington Square. It's in the basement, so please ring the bell and we'll buzz you in. All are welcome. We're looking forward to seeing you!

Edie Kantrowitz
President, NYCFC Emoji

Subway Info: A,B,C,D,E,F,M to West 4th Street station (at 6th Ave); N,R, to 8th Street station (at Broadway); 1 to Christopher Street station (at 7th Avenue).
results.name: NYC Friends of Clearwater November Gathering

Come meet us, network, drink, play board games and discuss activism related topics.

We will be wearing orange to show support the UN's UNiTE to End Violence against Women Campaign.


Every 25th of the month is deemed "Orange Day" and we encourage everyone to wear orange and raise awareness and take action against violence against women and girls. 

YWTF will be participating in the UN's "16 Days of Activism Against Gender-Based Violence" Campaign during Nov 25 - Dec 10. The UN's campaign aligns with YWTF's policy priorities to advocate for the end of Violence Against Women. We will be signing petitions and writing letters to our Governor and Congress to increase the amount of refugee resettlement in the United States, as women and children are especially vulnerable to Gender Based Violence in refugee situations.

results.description:
The second in a series of RPCV gatherings to share the stories and images of their service and raise money for the Peace Corps Partnership Program.

Cassidy Rush served in the rural village of Palma Herrada in the Northern Dominican Republic. He taught computer and business skills to school kids and college students and installed water filters for his village. After his service, he stayed on Hispanola, working in Haiti.
Cassidy has a wealth of photos and videos from his experience that he to share.

The event will take place at a private apartment -- the exact address will be emailed to confirmed attendees. Space is limited, so please RSVP appropriately. We're asking for an optional $10/pp donation which will be used to raise funds for the Peace Corps Partnership Program and contribute to the costs of the event. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/my-peace-corps-story-cassidy-rush-in-the-dominican-republic-2009-2011-tickets-19429607479

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
More and more people are disconnecting their cable television service. Why? Because high definition television (HDTV) is available over the air for free (and everything else can be streamed)! 

In this class, we'll start by learning about the basics of HDTV signals, where they fall on the electromagnetic spectrum, wavelengths and resonance. Then, in the second part of class, you'll build your own working HDTV indoor fractal antenna and test it out before you connect them at home.

$10 Fee includes all materials needed to build the antenna.

Hosts:

Norm Sutaria is a curriculum developer, trainer and instructional designer living in Astoria. After graduating from Syracuse and Montclair State Universities, he taught in the Montclair (N.J.) Public Schools, and worked at both Long Island University’s Brooklyn Campus and the New York City Office of Emergency Management. Norm enjoys DIY electronics and is actively involved in amateur radio, FIRST Robotics and the NY International Fringe Festival.

David Reeves is a member of Bergen Makerspace and ex-Director of Hack Manhattan. He cut off his cable TV in 2002 and ten years later got an amateur radio licence, and became fascinated with the magic of radio. He is an independent technology consultant specializing in 3D printing and electronics.
results.how_to_find_us: Bergen Makerspace is in the Adult Education Building on the Southern end of campus

results.description:
If we can give legal personhood and ever increasing rights to corporations (as per the Citizens United case), why not to Mother Nature instead? Rather than treating nature as property under the law, “Rights for Nature” acknowledges that nature in all its life forms has the right to exist, persist, maintain and regenerate its vital cycles. And we the people have the legal authority to enforce these rights on behalf of ecosystems. The ecosystem itself can be named as the defendant. Is this a radical concept? Yes and No. Countries like New Zealand, Bolivia and Ecuador have already actualized this concept in different forms, but the common thread is a link to indigenous culture. This is an idea whose time has come.  Join us to learn, explore and discuss this concept.

SPEAKER: Liz Marshall is an attorney in Blairstown, NJ. She is consultant for Genesis Farm, an Ecological Learning Center, writing about a variety of topics, including on the rights of nature. She is also a longtime member and trustee of the Community Supported Garden at Genesis Farm.

“You never change things by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete.”
Buckminster Fuller

“Every component of the Earth Community has three rights:—The Right To Be,—The Right to Habitat,—The Right to fulfill its role in the ever-renewing processes of the earth community.” Thomas Berry
results.how_to_find_us: Peierls Room (left-hand annex building, go upstairs and turn right)
results.name: DEEP ECOLOGY SERIES: Rights & Legal Personhood for Nature

Join us at the hottest club in NJ for a night you won’t soon forget! 

When 8minuteDating gets started, you'll have four 8-minute one-on-one conversations with singles in your age group followed by a 20-minute intermission where you can mix and mingle with other singles from this and its sister events that might have caught your eye. After the intermission, you'll have four more 8-minute dates. That's 8 great dates in one fun night!  

You'll enjoy delicious complimentary appetizers, ice breaker games, a cash bar and lots of raffle prizes. Plus after you've met all of your dates, you can be our guest in the club for a great night out.! What a way to start off the weekend! 


It's sure to be a great night and we guarantee you'll meet someone you want to see again or your next event is on us! So sign up soon because space is limited and advance registration at 8minuteDating.com is required.

Click here to register: http://www.8minutedating.com

My meetup group members can receive a $5 discount by entering promo code 8mdnynj5 in the appropriate space when registering at 8minuteDating.com!

PLEASE NOTE......the number of attendees listed on meetup.com is NOT indicative of the number of attendees who will actually attend this event. 99% of the attendees will register directly at 8minuteDating.com. My events usually have 50 - 100 attendees!

Sponsored by The Open Center, The New School for Social Research, InterfaceNYC, Hari Yoga, Evolver, MAPS, Floraura, Elephant House Productions, The Arborvitae School of Herbalism, NuAxon, Herbstalk, Samadhi Arts, Evolve and Ascend, Psymposia, Chimes, Kaia Foods, Cocoroons, Daily Greens, Sound Sparkling Tea, Love Grace

To Learn more: visit the website at www.eastmeetswestmedicinefest.com

To purchase tickets, visit:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-2nd-annual-east-meets-west-medicine-fest-tickets-19255968119

There is a quiet revolution taking place. This revolution supplants traditional knowledge and what you might call an intuitive or “eastern” understanding with modern, “western” science and technology-oriented research and investigation. This revolution, unlike any revolution that has come before it, is a celebration. It is a festival.

And you are invited.

This is a festival and conference for people who are done with festivals and conferences. This is for the people that are scientifically minded but know enough to know that contemporary science doesn’t have all the answers. This is for the people that want to explore traditional topics in medicine in a fresh, contemporary, young and modern way. This is where east meets west in an opportunity to learn from and engage with open-minded, eye-opening, idea-evolving, self-improving, community-building and thought-leading doctors, researchers, practitioners, patients, artists, performers, cultural innovators, movers and shakers.

Our mission is to introduce humanity to modern and traditional medicinal, musical and movement-based arts. We believe laughter is the best medicine, we reject all dogma, the only thing we know is that we know nothing at all, and we think that Ayurveda, Traditional Chinese Medicine, Consciousness Hacking, Western Biomedicine, Quantum Physics, Psychedelic Research, Freudian and Jungian Psychotherapy and Psychoanalysis, Art and Sound Therapy, Nutrition, Plant Medicine, Yoga and Meditation are all topics worthy of our consideration.

The East Meets West Medicine Fest is not only where the eastern mindframe meets the western, it is where the east coast meets the west coast. We are inspired by the explosion of the west coast music festival culture, the art, the music, the workshops and talks, and we are bringing it to the east coast in a novel form that focuses on the lectures and workshops as much as the music. We are breathing new life into the archetype of the festival so come here to engage, to listen, to be inspired and also to dance. Come here to meet your new physician, one who genuinely cares about your physical and mental well-being.

There will be Dr.’s and DJ’s, meditation and medication, technology and herbology, and a whole lot more. During the evening portion of the event on Saturday November 21st, taking place at and sponsored by The Open Center, there will be vendors, workshops, DJs, Visual Projections, Dancing, Art Spaces, Tea Service, Performances and more. And expect a weekend full of comedic intermissions.

Learn to take charge of your health in a way that’s accessible, affordable and enjoyable. This is your chance to be part of something big. If you are interested in participating as a volunteer, coming on as a sponsor, presenting as a speaker, showing off your art or offering your medical services by donation, don’t hesitate to reach out to us through the contact form on our website, or at [masked]

We will have a very small number of press passes and scholarship/discount tickets available, so please reach out to us if you are under severe financial duress. We have made these tickets as affordable as possible, and we don’t want anyone to be turned away for lack of funds, but seating is limited at this event, so we will do what we can to accommodate. We expect tickets to sell out, so buy yours while they last.

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE
This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .
It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Blue: Hip Hop
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance

There are limited spots (100), so make sure to reserve your tickets early!

Check in Location: The Playwright Irish Pub, 27 west 35th (2nd floor)
Check out: Lexington’s Bar , 39th and Lexington Avenue.
Check in time: 7:00pm – 8:00pm // Leave at: 8:00 pm
Party ends: ~11pm

Age Restriction: 21+

All Tickets Are Limited!

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.
results.name: Underground Party – Subway Tour!

results.description:
Opening Reception Event: November 20, 2015 at 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM

Exhibition Duration: November 13, 2015 - December 3, 2015

Location:Resobox Gallery
[masked]th Street, Long Island City, NY 11101
(Between Queens Plaza North and 41st Avenue) 

Price: Free admission!

RESOBOX Gallery is proud to present an exhibition of hand-painted nineteenth century Japanese photographs from The Burns Collection & Archive.

The ritual production of silk, rice and tea was integral to Japan’s Meiji Era economy. These photographs depict the manufacture, creation and utilization of these cultural and agricultural commodities. The images in this exhibition showcase the best of Japanese photographs that were created to introduce the basic industries of Japan to the West. The photographs were exported to international fairs and expositions, and it was through these photographs that the world was exposed to Japan. The Meiji Era production and process of silk, rice and tea are illustriously illustrated in these beautifully hand-painted nineteenth century photographs.

See more at our website!

http://resobox.com/japanese-ritual-industry-silk-rice-tea/
results.name: Japanese Ritual Industry: Rice, Silk & Tea Exhibition at Resobox!

results.description:
Hi, I am Giorgia and I want all the young people in NYC to learn how to play bridge!!! Come to our bridge club to learn the best game in the world, surrounded by people your age. Learn, have fun and meet new people :)

The meetup starts at 6:30pm, not sure it would not let me plan anything before 7pm. A buffet dinner will be available starting at 5:45pm and we will be done by around 8:30. We plan to all move to a close bar to have some drinks after the bridge lesson/play! 

I am waiting for you on the 30th but, if you can't attend for any reason, come next week! We will be there every Friday night :)

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drinks

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description: Hello, all! As most of you already know, I have a new release coming out Nov. 16. (All the pertinent info is at rebeccabrooksromance.com.) I will be having an informal get-together on Nov. 20 to discuss my new release with anyone who wants to talk about it and in general eat, imbibe, and have a bookish, celebratory night. (This doesn't give a lot of time to read but it's a fast one and obviously reading the book is not required!) I'm inviting another book club I'm a part of, as well as some friends and superfans, and am hoping this will be more entertaining and inclusive than a traditional book launch party and have the same laid back and fun vibe as book club. Feel free to invite anyone. Location is TBD depending on how many people it seems like will show up, so if you can let me know if you think you might come that would be great! I won't post the location on here because the Internet is creepy but will figure out the best way to let people know. (It will likely be either at my apt or at a more centrally located bar.)
results.name: Book club/party to discuss Rebecca Brooks's HOW TO FALL
