Please join Allan on 11/20/15 and steep yourself in awakened transmission and Heart presence. 

We will gather together to deeply explore the continuum of ALL of who We are as divinely humans, bringing awareness to our infinite Beingness as nonseparate from the joys, triumphs, pain and shadow of our humanness, all within the sacred container of mutuality.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend. 

A $20 donation is suggested to help us cover rental fee and travel costs. Please don't let funds keep you away, though.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

ABOUT ALLAN

Allan</a>’s divine Presence, compassionate holding, and melodious meanderings will leave you feeling soothed and nurtured. Come see for yourself why he’s been described as a “poem in motion” and a “mountain stream where you can find deep nourishment for your soul.”  You are invited to experience Allan’s transmission, especially via his poems and audio recordings, on his website, <a href="http://www.embodiedheartawakening.com/">www.embodiedheartawakening.com

results.description:
Permaculture Power Grids: Decentralized Energy

What would a smaller scale power grid look like in the northeastern U.S.?  


How can we address systemic contamination from lead,mercury and radioactive waste while solving human induced climate issues and energy and fuel  shortages of all kinds?

Andrew Faust will articulate a clear, elegant and scientifically solid approach to renewable and integrated designs for our regional energy needs—to transition our society to a healthier economy.


One of the premier Permaculture teachers and designers in North America with over two decades of experience in the field. His passionate and visionary presentations and curriculum have been inspiring and motivating teachers and students since his days as  a high school teacher at a hippie, freak, artist drop-out school, which he graduated from in 86' in Glenmoore, PA. 

Andrew lived off the grid in West Virginia for 8 years where he designed and built his Permaculture Ph.d homestead including a 1600 sq ft strawbale house. He moved to Brooklyn in 2007 and has been applying his knowledge to the urban landscape culminating in a Permaculture Design Certification course, with over 500 graduates in NYC, many consider life changing.


Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5-$10 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup.
results.name: Permaculture Power Grids @ Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

results.name: SPANISH! Level intermediate

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.
results.how_to_find_us: Please ask the doorman for the location.
results.name: Friday Night - Instructed Drawing Session

results.description:
Brilliant Moon chronicles the life of the writer, poet, and meditation master Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, one of Tibet's most revered 20th-century Buddhist teachers. Known as the instructor of His Holiness the Dalai Lama and the Royal Family of Bhutan, his life and teachings were an inspiration to all who encountered him. Two of his admirers are Richard Gere and Lou Reed, who provide the narration for his dangerous journey out of China and the subsequent spread of his influence around the world. Brilliant Moon was filmed in Tibet, India, Bhutan, the United States and Nepal, and uses animation, rare archival footage and interviews with some of Tibet's great thinkers, to tell his moving life story, from birth to death to rebirth. Written and Directed by Neten Chokling (Milarepa), one of Khyentse Rinpoche's students, it is an intimate, moving and revelatory look at a transcendent spiritual being.

Please enjoy this fascinating film with us. Bring something to eat or drink for our potluck table. Movie Night is free and open to the public. Our space is small, so please arrive on time.
results.name: Movie Night @ Rigpa - Brilliant Moon

Or just come by explore the space, have a beer with us and see what creations are developing in the MakerBar community.....

http://www.rtl-sdr.com/rtl-sdr-quick-start-guide/


For those curious about other compatible software see this link for more info:

http://www.rtl-sdr.com/big-list-rtl-sdr-supported-software/

END TRANSMISSION.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive!

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Model Spotlight: Glamour & Implied Shoot w/Neesy Rizzo - Nov. 20th"

We have a last minute Model Spotlight shoot with none other than Neesy Rizzo this Friday. We're taking the opportunity to work with Neesy before the New Year and we have a few sexy looks in store.

About Model Spotlight shoots:

With this type of shoot there will be one model. (Max. 4 photographers) It could be a traveling model, one of our member favorites or a model with a unique concept. These shoots are designed to be more intricate as far as lighting scheme, concepts and free form. (The freedom to adjust lighting, sets, add props and make the look your own with plenty of time to do so.) We will have a basic starting point for the look but you are encouraged to experiment. (Me and Joe will be on hand to help where needed.)

About this Shoot:

We have three looks planned. (with a possible 4th pending time) We are planning a "shower" look, with a more dramatic lighting scheme. We have a boudoir, lingerie/implied look. (Bed setup) We are also bringing Christmas a little early with a Christmas modern pinup look. (High Key, lingerie, implied)

RSVP:

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup so you know what to expect at the shoot. 

NEW: Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. From here on in, we have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. This will ensure that we have the minimum amount of RSVP to actually hold the Meetup. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit. Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page.

Total Cost: $70

Deposit: $20 (Paypal)

(Balance due at time of shoot: $50, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.)

(Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.)

Models: 

Neesy Rizzo: Instagram and Facebook

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. So, at the very least give us 3 days notice that you will not be able to attend or in case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up past the 3 days notice, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the models beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup.

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels within the 3 days before the shoot, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes". Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]

results.description:
More than 60 years after her tragic death, Marilyn Monroe remains one of the greatest female sex legends in American film history.  She became the embodiment of the pleasure dream of American men. 

Sadly, there is a harsh reality behind Monroe’s illusory phantasmagoric story. A silicone prosthesis in her jaw corrected a slight overbite, electrolysis corrected her hairline, and she underwent surgery for endometriosis and a cholecystomy.  She was unable to achieve orgasm until in therapy shortly before her death, and she struggled with addiction, depression and anxiety.

Besides the overtly displayed curvy silhouette, there was a heavy dose of genuine naturalness and humanism. In this talk and discussion, we will explore this hidden side, and how her image and popularity reflect important existential aspects of our individual and social lives.

Humanist Counselor Joseph Ben-David’s comprehensive research of Monroe’s phenomenal persona went beyond the framework of her popularly known life history and her overt political impact. 

A program of the Humanist Foundation. Info:[masked]; [masked]

All are welcome. Socialize and meet like-minded people in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Light refreshments. Free admission.

results.name: The Humanism of Marilyn Monroe

Singer/ songwriter — and ukelele player — Honor Finnegan with Aviv Roth on guitar combines elements of musical theatre, comedy, traditional folk, and poetry in her performance. Honor’s songs are humorous, then heartbreaking, with melodies that soar.

Honor Finnegan is the Susan Boyle of quirky indie folk, only hotter.  Based in New York City, she has been making a splash in the northeastern regional folk scene with her original songs and ukulele playing. Combining elements of musical theatre, comedy, traditional folk, and poetry, Honor is cooler than the other side of the pillow. Check out her website!

results.description:
I'm organizing this additional event with the Swedish actor and playwright Andrea Larsdotter, who will be in New York on November 20th. It will be very useful to open up creativity and produce more material to work on in our regular Wine & Creative Writing sessions.
Andrea Lasdotter has developed a technique named WAXA MEDIMOVE, which contemplates body movement and visualization. It is a tool for writers, actors, and even healers.
I have participated in one of her workshops and found it extremelly powerful. Writers should not forget that their body is always involved in writing: body and mind are one thing.
WAXA was never brought to the US so far, while it is very well known in Scandinavia.
This will be a unique occasion, because Andrea lives in Stockholm.
For more information, check the website:
https://waxainstructor.wordpress.com/about-waxa-medimoves/

Cost of meeting is $ 20 dollars. Wear confortable clothes.
Paper and pen will be provided.

Room PH!

results.description:
Join us @ Rio Bravo for Great Mexican cuisine!!!

At Rio Bravo Tacos and Tequila in Larchmont, formerly The Globe, there's a build-your-own margarita menu and customizable table-side guacamole, in addition to a long menu of Mexican-American standbys like tacos, carnitas and enchiladas.

A good fit for both ladies night and family outings, Rio Bravo's menu is affordable (most entrees cost between $8 and $16) and offers a mix-and-match option so indecisive eaters can choose one item from each section and sample everything.

The space is festive and saturated with color (each wall painted is a different one), and there are Dia de los Muertos statues set in lit alcoves. The sunny street-facing dining room connects to the bar in the back, where there are 55 varieties of tequilas and fun margarita combinations (available in pitchers), like the flaming and salty Torero.

Keep an eye on the restaurant's Facebook page for happy hour and weekday specials, such as Taco Tuesday, Karaoke Thursday and Mariachi Sunday.

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.

results.description:
Only two Nerd Nites remain in 2015, so please join us back in Brooklyn on Friday November 20 for three funny-yet-smart presentations about James Bond technology (Seth Porges will set a Nerd Nite record with this one), bed bugs (you’ll start itching), and evolutionary psychology (to explain why big boobs are bootylicious).  Oh, and we’re bringing trivia back instead of speed dating (perhaps cozy-up to a single fella or lass and let the seductive art of answering questions take its natural course?).  Fun fun fun! 

BUY TICKETS HERE: https://www.ticketfly.com/purchase/event/993469

.

Nerd Nite NYC


Friday November 20, 2015
Littlefield
622 Degraw Street (Gowanus/Park Slope)
Trivia+Presentations at 7:30pm (Doors at 6:30pm): $14 – buy tickets
Presentations-only at 9pm (Doors at 8:45pm): $10 – buy tickets

Back to the Lectures At-Hand:
*Presentation #1
The Man With The Golden Gadgets: The Secret History of James Bond Gadgets
by Seth Porges

Description: From invisible cars to space lasers to prosthetic nipples, James Bond’s seemingly endless supply of impossibly convenient gadgets have been a big part in making the film franchise so iconic. And for more than 50 years, these Q Branch creations have developed into a sort of shadow technological history that has both been inspired—and been inspired by—real-life tech. Here, journalist Seth Porges takes a look at the surprising stories behind many of Bond’s most famous—and infamous—toys.

Bio: Seth Porges is a technology journalist, entrepreneur, TV commentator, and co-founder of Cloth for iOS. A former editor (and current contributor) at Maxim and Popular Mechanics, he also contributes to InStyle, Fast Company, Self, Men’s Journal, Mashable, and Forbes. In addition to making regular appearances on cable news as a science and technology analyst, he appears on four series currently in rotation on History, Discovery, and National Geographic. His recently produced documentary series “The Most Insane Amusement Park Ever” was based on a prior Nerd Nite talk. You can follow him on Twitter at @sethporges, or Facebook.

*Presentation #3
Why You Like Big Boobs: An Evolutionary Perspective on Beauty Standards   
by Melissa Blundell Osorio

Description: Are beauty standards created solely by the media? Why are we attracted to what we’re attracted to? Take a look into the science of beauty, seen in the context of a Darwinian struggle for survival.

Bio: For fun, Melissa is a proud nerd and Co-Boss of Nerd Nite Miami, following years of being a fan and audience member for Nerd Nite NYC. For work, she is the founder of Night School, a learning lab and a community initiative, offering classes and events for Miamians who are intellectually adventurous and constantly curious.

results.description:
This is our Asia Business Network monthly meeting. We meet at a location near Grand Central in Midtown Manhattan for business networking. We are joined by English students from Asia, who are either working or studying as professionals in Banking, Business, Economics, and Finance. They are in America learning English and are interested in business relationships with Asians in America.

There are networking activities and a conversation topic is introduced to the group. There is a short lecture and there is discussion on the conversation topic. The conversation topic is always Asian Banking, Business, Economics, or Finance related!  Asian business current events are introduced to the group, and economic issues that are important to Asians in America are discussed. Social networking time is also given.

There is going to be an Asian language exchange and there is English language instruction offered at this event.

At the end of the meeting the group is invited to go to Karaoke, or an Asian club, bar, or pub. The location is usually in China Town or Korea Town.

The number of English students in the meetup is given to the right of the event organizers name as pluses to the meeting. The students include a large number of graduate students from Columbia and NYU.  Erik is the host of the event. Erik has had years of experience in hosting Asian events in New York. Erik is a established member of the Asian community in the area and he improves networking performance by encouraging social networking and giving coaching for relationship building.

Translation Services: There is a Chinese - English translator in the group, whose services are for members in need of them. There is a Vietnamese translator whose services are offered upon request. The group is planning on adding a Japanese - English and Korean - English translator also. Erik the organizer is also familiar with Indonesian and Mongolian. Indonesian and Mongolian translation services are also going to be offered upon request. Translation services are free.

When the monthly attendance for this event exceeds 30, it is going to be made a weekly event.

There is a $5.00 fee for attending this event.

Thank you,
Erik
The Asian Business Network Organizer
results.name: Asia Business Network's Monthly Social

results.description:
The Folk Music Society of NY celebrates Jean Ritchie, the “Mother of Folk”, her life and music with a gathering to sing the songs that have inspired and touched so many.  The concert takes place at 7:30pm at St John's Lutheran Church, 81 Christopher Street, Manhattan (just West of 7th Avenue).  Contribution: General public $25, Folk Society members $20. Tickets are available at the door or online at:  http://jeanritchie.bpt.me .

Ritchie embodies the folk tradition, born to a ballad singing family of eastern Kentucky

“[Jean] brought hundreds of traditional songs from her native Appalachia to a wide audience — singing of faith and unfaithfulness, murder and revenge, love unrequited and love lost — and in the process helped ignite the folk song revival of the mid-20th century." The New York Times


This celebration of Jean's life and music brings together a number of performers whose lives were touched by Jean. This special evening organized by Dan Schatz includes Jean’s sons Jon and Peter Pickow, Cathy Fink and Marcy Marxer, Susie Glaze, Lorraine and Bennett Hammond, Mick Lane, Lisa Null, Tom Paxton, Sally Rogers and Howie Bursen, Dan Schatz, Ken Schatz, Happy Traum, and Heather Wood.

St John's Lutheran Church is half a block west of the #1 train - Christopher Street stop or a short walk from the West 4th St. station on the A, C, D, E or F trains.

Contribution: General public $25, Folk Society members $20.


Tickets are available at the door or online.
results.name: Jean Ritchie Memorial Concert

results.description:
What’s it all about? Is spirituality part of your everyday life? How do you find it? Each monthly conversation will focus on a specific topic or question to guide the conversation.

Upcoming topic:    An Intimate Relationship with God

While all other relationships may come and go, the one that always remains is the one we have with God. It never dies, is not fickle, and loves us no matter what. How does one develop a relationship with God? What does it mean to give and receive divine love? Explore how your relationship with God affects your everyday life, including your interactions with friends, family, and other loved ones.

Please join us for this open discussion format—come to explore ideas, share your experiences, ask questions, or hear from others. Our goal is to learn from and honor each other’s spiritual insights in a relaxed and comfortable environment. We look forward to meeting you for the first time or seeing you again. Feel free to bring a friend.

This Meetup repeats on the 3rd Friday of every month at the same location and time. Look for our future postings, including conversations on these topics: The Quest for Truth … Is Life a Random Walk? … Dreams are Real—What is Their Purpose? … You Have Lived Before—Past Lives and Karmic Ties…What’s Love Got to Do With It? … When Love Replaces Fear … Are There Spiritual DOs and DON’Ts? … Soul Travel and Out-of-Body Experiences … Awaken to Greater Spirituality in Your Life … An Intimate Relationship with God

Panera Bread at 15 Bloomfield Ave. Montclair, NJ 
(In Glenmont Square next to 7-ELEVEN; parking available)


For information on other events being held throughout the state,
visit www.eckankar-nj.org

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
When you’re on a spiritual path it is easy to revert back to old patterns, fearful behavior, and guilt. 

On my previous spiritual paths, I would revert back to guilt and fear whenever I would veer away from my spiritual path. It was a never ending circle that made me feel powerless and disconnected from my loving Self. 

In this lecture, I will offer you guidance on what to do when you fall off your spiritual path, how to remain consistent, and how to stop expecting perfection from yourself. 

Cost: $15 (but no one will be turned away who cannot pay)
results.name: How To Stay On The Spiritual Path

results.description:
RSVPs are now open.  Let’s gather for another meetup to discuss all things conservative. For those of you interested in our Presidential election, here’s a good link to keep up with the latest on who’s running in 2016: http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2016/us/elections/2016-presidential-candidates.html?_r=1

We have 15 candidates running for the GOP Presidential candidacy in 2016 including: JEB BUSH (former Governor of FL), BEN CARSON (former neurosurgeon), TED CRUZ (Senator of TX), CARLY FIORINA (former CEO of HP), JOHN KASICH (Governor of OH), RAND PAUL (Senator of KY), MARCO RUBIO (Senator of FL), DONALD TRUMP (real estate developer and TV personality), CHRIS CHRISTIE (Governor of NJ), MIKE HUCKABEE (former Governor of AR), RICK SANTORUM (former Senator of PA), JIM GILMORE (former Governor of VA), LINDSEY GRAHAM (Senator of SC), and GEORGE PATAKI (former Governor of NY).  Whom do you support and why?

Thank you all for your cooperation in keeping your RSVPs accurate and updated.  (No one appreciates coming out to a meetup expecting X number of attendees only to find Y some didn't show.) We hope you can join us and we look forward to seeing old friends and making new ones!


ABOUT:The New York Conservatives Meetup Group

WHO: We are a group of like-minded individuals who believe in upholding American conservative values fiscally, culturally, and politically. If you are a Conservative, Libertarian, Constitution Party, Neocon, Tea Party supporter or Republican, we welcome to you join our group and attend our meetings.

WHAT: We are a political and social discussions group, not an activist group, although activist members are welcome to join our group.

WHEN: We meet monthly, usually the 3rd Friday of each month, although there are occasional monthly exceptions as posted on this Meetup page.

WHERE: Our meetup is held at a restaurant in the Theater District, near Times Square in Manhattan. We chose this location for the convenience of mass transportation for all our Tri-State members, predominately those who reside in New York City and New Jersey.

WHY: Because we are sorely outnumbered by Liberals and Democrats in our Tri-State area. This meetup is intended for us get together to discuss and find common ground with each other.
results.name: The New York Conservatives Meetup Group Monthly Meetup

The appearance is no longer informed by the search for the end of the fear of death and the neurotic outcroppings of that search, but everything is still, everything. results.description:
If you're worried about overeating this holiday season, then just grab your step counter and burn some calories with us this Friday at Stepping Out!


The Intermediate series for the month of November is called "Bulletproof Your Dancing." This week, we'll be learning about Turning Techniques: "Turning may be fun—but it can also be dizzying and dangerous. Join us to perfect your turning technique so you can spin with the pros!"

Stepping Out Studios is a beautiful space on the 9th floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the key pad to the right of the building entrance.

******************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson w/ Adriana and Jeanette

8:30pm-9:30pm - Intermediate Lesson w/ Laura

9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Stan

****************************************************************************


The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12. But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night! (Volunteering gets you in for free! [masked] for more info!)

Bring socks or dance shoes with slippery soles (for easy turning). It's especially important to have clean, dry show

All ages. No bar, but it is BYOB. Water is provided.

There is no dress code, but hygiene is important and dressing up a bit is a nice thing to do. Prioritize comfort and ability to move!

****************************************************************************CLASS DESCRIPTIONS:

Fundamentals (8:30pm-9:30pm):

Fundamentals classes are for students new to blues dance and experienced students looking to hone their blues dance fundamentals. We cover how to connect with the music, how to connect with a partner, and have a rotating set of material to introduce students to important concepts in blues partner dance. These classes will give you everything you need to know to have a successful dance, and whet your appetite for more!


Intermediate (8:30pm-9:30pm**):

Intermediate series are technique-based classes designed to build specific knowledge and skills in students with prior blues dance experience. Intermediate classes are aimed to expand your knowledge depth in a specific topic of blues vocabulary through body awareness and historical context. Ultimately, taking class is your vehicle to having even more fun on the dance floor!

**Please plan to arrive on time. After 15 minutes have passed, students are no longer allowed to enter class.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks 
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

results.description:
Is salsa dancing and learning on your bucket list? If so, then you should come to La Fama, a Salsa dancing party that takes place every Friday in Times Square. Come out, bring your friends, and leave your worries and stress at home. With admission, you can take our complimentary FREE salsa dancing class and dance all night long to great salsa tracks played by our DJ. Here are the details:

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris unless there is an invited instructor. Here is silvio In action:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-cNukVLJo

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMy3EtfWqSY

results.description:
Bellydancing and Arabic Music Trio tonight at Tagine. To book your reservation call[masked]-6265. Limited space.

221 West 38th Street NYC 10018

Sami is an Arabic violinist, vocalist, and rababa player, co-founder and musical director of Zikrayat (www.zikrayatmusic.com), and a teacher and scholar of maqam and Arabic music. His field of expertise is in the Egyptian and Syrian music traditions, and Zikrayat highlights gems from the “Golden Age” of Egyptian Cinema, the 1930’s-60’s, presenting exciting dance numbers alongside classical Tarab repertory. 


With Zikrayat, founded in 2006, he has performed at Lincoln Center, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Joe’s Pub, GlobalFEST, the American Folk Festival, the Lowell Folk Festival, the Global Film and Music Festival at William & Mary, Galapagos Art Space, Alwan for the Arts, and numerous other venues.

Brian Prunka composes and performs jazz and middle-eastern influenced music with his own projects (such as Nashaz and the Near East River Ensemble). In addition, he currently performs with The New York Arabic Orchestra, Simon Shaheen, Zikrayat, the Bil Afrah Project and others. Although he spent his musically formative years immersed in the jazz community of New Orleans, for the past decade Brian has been based in Brooklyn. Always drawn to a wide range of music without regard to boundaries, national or otherwise, Brian began his deep study of Arabic music over 15 years ago when he began playing the oud. His many diverse compositions and distinct improvisational style express his personal musical journey. He has performed throughout the U.S. and internationally with Simon Shaheen, Michael Bates, Ravish Momin, the New York Arabic Orchestra, The Vancouver International Orchestra, Zikrayat, The Near East River Ensemble, and others. In addition to national and international events, he has performed in New York at The Stone, Tonic, the Knitting Factory, the River to River Festival, Symphony Space, Alwan for the Arts, Trinity Church, and CBGBs, among others. www.nashazmusic.com

Zafer Tawil is a virtuoso on ‘oud, violin, and qanun, and a master of Arab percussion. Zafer has performed in concerts across the country, including performances with numerous musicians ranging from Sting to Arab music virtuosos Chab Mami, Simon Shaheen, Bassam Saba and George Ziadeh, to avant-garde composer/ performer Elliot Sharpe. He was a featured composer and performer in acclaimed director Jonathan Demme's Oscar-nominated film Rachel Getting Married and Zeitoun, based on Dave Eggers’ book about Abdulrahman Zeitoun’s post-Hurricane Katrina odyssey. Zafer has worked on many collaborative concerts involving classical Indian and Persian music, Arabic/jazz fusion, and Arabic music at many institutions and universities across the United States. A native of Jerusalem, Palestine, he resides in New York City.
results.name: Zikrayat Trio + Bellydancing at Tagine Fine Moroccan Cuisine

results.description:
Hey y'all, It's short notice, but it's been a while since we had a drinks thang, so I hope you can come out to clink glasses with your pals from Manhattan Muay Thai tomorrow. We'll be meeting at Shrine, a cool music venue in Harlem (near 134th and Adam Clayton Powell - shrinenyc.com), where another friend of mine will be filming a performance of Michael Veal & Aqua IFE, an afro-beat band. (If you're not familiar with afro-beat, it's funky/jazzy rebel music from Nigeria whose founding father was Fela Ransom Kuti.) Anyway, any excuse to have a drink with friends, is a good excuse! Admission is FREE before 11pm, and I'll be there - or at least somewhere nearby - well before then, so text me when you're on your way up so we can converge. Yann and Alex have said they're coming, so I hope to see a bunch of you crazies there.

Neil
results.name: Lift a few with Manhattan Muay Thai

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE
This party is indoor/outdoor, so it’s going on rain or shine!

Join us for our Quiet Clubbing Party at the outdoor Studio Square Beer Garden! Drinks, food, and 3 DJs spinning at the same time to keep you singing and partying all night…Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing, you’ll have two other choices to dance and have fun to.

DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop, etc
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

All Tickets Are Limited, So Get Them ASAP!

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: $5 Quiet Clubbing At Studio Square!

results.description:
The Freedom Party® is the longest running Friday-night dance party in NYC history! Created in 2003 by Herbert Holler, DJ Cosi and Marc Smooth, Freedom’s mission is to preserve the genuine, classic NYC nightlife vibe by putting music first and providing a place for people from all walks of life to dance and be free, regardless of whom they know or how much money they make. Playing a tight mix of danceable, soulful hits from the 60s through today, including hip-hop, house, disco, R&B classics, rock, reggae, classic pop and more, the Freedom Party® continues to fill its dance floor each week with positive, fun, beautiful people from all over the globe looking to have an unforgettable NYC party experience.

http://www.brooklynbowl.com/event/970607-freedom-party-nyc-brooklyn/

Depends on which motor coach is used. Have to collect money early due to tickets selling fast and for bus deposits. Send Checks to Charleen Breckenridge, 9109 Amber Oaks Way, Owings Mills,Maryland,21117 Or You may use PayPal as well, using my e-mail address,[masked] Send by picking Friends And Family. Phone #[masked] Cell #[masked]

With an infectious jazz score and exuberant dancing, Shuffle Along ignited not just Broadway but all of New York City. George Gershwin, Fanny Brice, Al Jolson, Langston Hughes, and famed critic George Jean Nathan were among the many fans who repeatedly flocked to West 63rd Street to see a cast which - during its run of 504 performances - featured such incipient luminaries as Josephine Baker, Paul Robeson, Florence Mills, Fredi Washington, and Adelaide Hall. Because of Shuffle Along, Uptown and Downtown met and became one.

6-time Tony Award Winner Audra McDonald returns to Broadway! An All-star cast in the musical sensation of the year!Audra McDonald, Brian Stokes Mitchell, Billy Porter, Brandon Victor Dixon, Joshua Henry SHUFFLE ALONG or the making of the musical sensation of 1921 an all that followed Music and Lyrics by Noble Sissle and Eubie Blake, Book By George C. Wolfe, Original Book by F.E. Miller and Aubrey Lyles, Choreographed by Savion Glover, Directed by George C. Wolfe
Bus pick-up TBD

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee! 

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone

results.description:
TRIP IS SOLD OUT FOR NOVEMBER 21-29, 2015

AVAILABLE SPOTS IN 2016 

If interested in signing up before then just drop an email to [masked] or call[masked] .


November 21 - 29, 2015 (over Thanksgiving)  - If you want to go on this trip it would be best to sign up earlier rather than later as holiday airfare will keep going up and up!

What is included:

• 8 nights accommodation in casa particulares, double occupancy, breakfast included

• Private Cuban guide throughout

• Private Globe Drifters host throughout (per United States Dept of Treasury requirements)

• Private transportation in air conditioned bus 

• Activities as noted on itinerary

• Meals as indicted in itinerary: All breakfasts, 7 lunches, 7 dinners

• Mandatory medical insurance ( refer to travel insurance section for more information)

• Roundtrip Charted International flight

• Visa processing fee and cost 

What is NOT included:

• Domestic airfare to and from Miami and overnight stay if needed 

• 25 CUC airport departure tax from Cuba

• Two dinners and two lunches

• Drinks

• Gratuities

• Souvenirs 

** We suggest bringing an extra $400-$600 for your trip and if you plan on drinking lots of mojito's and buying lots of souvenirs maybe $1,000. We ask you bring more with you as there is no way to get more cash in Cuba so best to be prepared with extra cash on hand in case you run into an emergency. 

So Cuba has become quite popular over the last few months and sadly the large tour groups are capitalizing on this by pricing their trips quite high as competition is minimal. The trips below are priced as one of the most affordable trips on the market.  They are also the most fun in my opinion!  Cuba is a bit more expensive as you need to have a charter flight from Miami to Havana. See specifics below.

Viva La Revolucion!

Let's learn the conga as we dance to the Afro-Cuban beat of the drums!

And as my all time idol Gloria says "Don't worry if you can't dance, let the music move your feet!"

Cuba is only 90 miles away from America yet it has been shrouded in mystery for more than 50 years due to heavy US sanctions. As many of you know those sanctions are being slowly lifted and the door has opened allowing Americans to finally discover this amazing country and its people. Cuba offers a diverse and colorful history as well as a unique view into a country that has had little to work with over the last 50 years and yet with so little the people remain optimistic towards the future.  Come see Cuba before McDonalds and Starbucks move in!

The trips offered by Globe Drifters are some of the most affordable legal Cuban trips on the market for Americans. We work with an overseas company that has specialized in Cuba travel for over 10 years, therefore you know you are getting a quality product. The max amount of travelers in a group is 12 people. Most other tour groups have an average of 15-30 people in their groups and with this many people it does NOT allow for easy travel and is more “tour groupish.” Large groups are less able to integrate into a society and generally have less authentic contact with the locals. The more people in the tour group, the more the group experiences their own culture rather than the one of the country they are visiting.  We are committed to keeping our groups at 12 travelers or less in order to keep the trips authentic. Also, in order to stay at the local ‘casas’ (guesthouses) where there are limited rooms we need the group to remain intimate and small. Due to the high number of people that want to travel to Cuba  your group will be relatively full with 10-12 people in each trip.

If you would like to stay abreast of trip details join the Cuba Facebook Event!

Cuba Facebook Event

The trips offered above fall under the United States Department of Treasury’s guidelines for legal travel to Cuba for American citizens. More information on this is provided at www.globedriftertours.com 

Price for 9-day trip to Cuba

$2,300 – Trip cost (see above for what is included and not included)

$600 – International roundtrip flight to and from Havana (via Miami) and Cuban Visa** In December flights increase by $100

$2,900 – Grand Total 

*** On a side note, most trips to Cuba for Americans average around $4,000 not including flight

What What! There is no single supplement! 

Accommodation is on a twin share basis and, if you are traveling on your own, you will be sharing a room with another traveller of the same sex. If there are an odd number of group members and you have to have a room to yourself, you do not have to pay extra. If at some stage during the tour you wish to have a room to yourself, the tour leader can arrange this on a request basis and charge you the difference in cost. This is subject to availability.

If you decide at the booking stage, that you want a single room throughout the tour, you can buy the “single supplement“.  The single supplement fee for this trip is very reasonable at $375. 

If you snore really loudly or are a smoker you should consider getting the single supplement as it is very cheap. 

Cuba 9 Day Itinerary

The purpose of this itinerary is to give you an idea of the types of activities you will engage in during the tour, however, it may change based on numerous factors. If certain activities do change, they will be substituted for similar ones to ensure you will have a full-schedule of activities designed to facilitate an understanding of the many different facets of Cuba; Culture, History, Society, Economics, and Environment.

Day 1: Arrive Havana 

Welcome to Cuba! Today we arrive in Havana and settle into our B&B accommodations in the old city. Meet the local tour leader and take a short walk around Havana. Dinner tonight will be at a local paladar, a privately owned restaurant, and a great example of Cuba’s incremental shift to a more free-market economy. Paladar means “palate” and is named after a chain of restaurants in a Brazilian soap opera popular in Cuba. We will attend the famous cannon ceremony at 9 p.m. The cannon blast dates back to the 17th century.

Included:

Arrival transfer included.

Activities: First meeting at 6pm, orientation walk, cannon blast.

Meal: Dinner included at a local paladar.

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 2: Havana 

The best place to start any Cuba experience is in the Old City. Havana’s Old City is one of the best preserved colonial cities in all of the Americas, and was designated a World Heritage Site in 1982. The streets are lined with colonial architecture, 16th century fortresses and countless churches. The guided walking tour of Old Havana will take you visit La Catedral San Cristobal de la Habana, the Palacio de los Marqueses de Aguas Claras and the Plaza de Armas. We will also visit the Museo de la Revolucion, to learn about the history of the Cuban Revolution and see the infamous Hall of Cretins. After lunch we visit the fishing village of Jaimanitas and the home of the famous artist Jose Fuster. Fuster has made his entire home, and much of the surrounding neighborhood, into an artwork using tiles in mosaic forms. Now referred to as Fusterlandia, it is a unique work of public art with over 80 houses decorated with ornate murals and domes to suit the personality of each of Fuster’s neighbours. You will be able to meet with the family to discuss their art projects and view the gallery in Jose Fuster’s home. Free time for dinner to explore one of many delicious paladars.

Included: 

Activities: AM: City tour led by local leader. PM: Visit Fusterlandia

Meals: Breakfast, Lunch (Dinner not included: Leader will recommend a local paladar you choose own meal.)

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 3: Viñales via Las Terrazas (Travel time approx. 4 hours)

Viñales is situated in one of the most picturesque parts of Cuba, among the limestone pincushion hills (“mogotes”) of the Pinar del Rio province. It is a small and culturally rich village, with friendly and welcoming residents and wide variety of outdoor activities available.

On the way to Viñales we visit in the community of Las Terrazas. The village was built as part of a government reforestation project and has since received a UNESCO biosphere listing. Meet up with our local community leader who will share with us some insight into Las Terrazas and how society works. We will visit the ecological research centre and take a local guided walk around the Las Terrazas complex – Here take a refreshing dip in a nearby river!

We will reach Vinales in time to tour an organic farm and learn about sustainable farming in Cuba. Here we meet our local farmer and his family who will show us around the organic farm and explain to us the methods used to cultivate crops without the use of pesticides. Back at the house, lend a hand and learn ‘hands on’ how they farm here. With the beautiful sunset as our backdrop, we will enjoy a deliciously fresh and diverse meal prepared by the family, a truly authentic farm-to-fork experience! 

Included: 

Activities: AM: Travel to Las Terrazas a project of sustainable rural economy. PM: Travel to Vinales ,orientation walk of the city and visit an organic farm

Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 4: Viñales 

Today we spend the morning learning more about Cuban agriculture with a visit to a local tobacco farm where we learn about the tradition of Cuban cigars from a farmer and expert cigar maker. Get an insight as to how the communist system works, how much tobacco they will keep, how much produce they give back to the government and how they make ends meet! You will learn about the process of tobacco planting to rolling the final cigar. We will share in the secret recipe from one family passed down through 3 generations of how they cure their leaves for cigars, drink some freshly roasted coffee from the farm while we watch an expert roll us some cigars. Viñales is one of the more agriculturally productive areas, so an abundance of local seasonal fruit and vegetables is always on offer such as enormous avocados and mangoes, pineapples, papaya, guava, and a several varieties of sweet potatoes. In the afternoon we learn to cook Cuban-style with a cooking lesson from a local chef. We will accompany the chef to the local markets to buy the ingredients for our platos tipicos Cubanos like congri, potaje, garbanzo soup, ajiaco, and flan. After the cooking lesson we can sit back and relax to enjoy the well prepared meal.

Included:

Activities: Visit a local Tabacco farm. PM. Cooking lesson from a local chef

Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 5: Playa Giron/Playa Larga via Cienfuegos (Travel time approx. 4 hours)

Today we depart for Cienfuegos the “Pearl of the South”, a city founded by the French, which lends it a distinctly European flavor, with a wide Parisian-style boulevard and elegant colonnades. Like Havana, Cienfuegos has a beautiful Malecón, where you can pass a peaceful evening watching fisherman cast nets and locals socialize. On the way to Cienfuegos we visit the Korimakao Cultural Project in Ciénega de Zapata, an area famous for its wetlands. Korimakao is a project founded in 1992 to bring theatre, music, and dancing to remote areas of Cuba. Here we will meet with the teachers, directors who will talk to us about the importance of this project and the number of students that benefit from such a project in this area.

After lunch, we drive along the picturesque Bay of Pigs past the site where the landing of U.S. sponsored counter-revolutionary exile militia occurred in 1961. Today there is a museum here that recounts the events of this conflict which resulted in the first defeat of a U.S backed take-over in Latin America. There are some beautiful places to stop for a swim along the way including a sink hole which resembles a huge natural tropical fish tank, so make sure to pack your swim wear and snorkeling gear if you have any (or you can rent it!).

On arrival to Cienfuegos we settle into our homestays before taking a walk around the city to learn its history. In the evening we join together for another delicious home cooked meal with a local family.

Included:

Activities: AM: Visit Korimakao. PM: travel to Cienfuegos, orientation walk of the city

Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 6: Trinidad (Travel time approx. 6 hours)

The beautiful colonial city of Trinidad is home to numerous churches and many beautiful colonial buildings. We are near the lovely Valle de los Ingenios (Valley of Sugarmills) and Playa Ancón. We begin with a cultural tour of Trinidad where we will visit various museums including the Afro Cuban temple to Yemaya and learn about the Afro-Cuban religion. We will be invited to sit and learn about the religion and it’s deities from the official caretaker -a priest called Israel. After lunch we will learn about the dancing scene in Cuba. We’ll start by meeting the Afro Cuban Folkloric dance group that perform Afro Cuban shows at the club Palenque. We’ll learn about the cultural and social importance that dancing has to Cuba. We’ll be welcomed into the venue where they train and perform before taking on a Cuban salsa class. Nightlife in Trinidad is probably the most accessible and intense in all of Cuba, with numerous live music venues and many dance performances every day of the week, all amongst the enchanting setting of old colonial buildings and the cobblestone streets.

Included:

Activities: AM: Orientation walk of the city & Cultural tour of Trinidad. PM: dance lesson

Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 7: Trinidad

Today we will learn about the history of the area and the local industry and biodiversity as we take a short hike to a waterfall outside of the city with a local expert guide. On the way we stop in a very simple campesino’s home to learn about life in the rural areas of Cuba. After cooling off in the natural pools, we return to Trinidad where you’ll have the rest of the afternoon to relax and explore. For dinner tonight we have a special bonfire BBQ at Playa Ancon with a local musician and a delicious array of local Cuban specialties prepared by our favorite local chefs.

Included:

Activities: AM: Walk to waterfall. PM: BBQ at Playa Ancon

Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 8: Havana via Santa Clara (Travel time approx. 3.5 hours)

On the way back to Havana we first pass by Manaca Iznaga 16km East of Trinidad in the Valle de los Ingenios. A 44m tower was built to look over the slaves as they worked. It has a sugar cane press that the slaves used to operate, and the village around the mansion is inhabited by direct descendants of the slaves. Here we will learn more about the slave trade. Continuing onwards, we stop in at the town of Santa Clara, a key city in the Cuban Revolution. Upon entering Santa Clara, we will see the iconic statue of Ernesto Ché Guevara, built to commemorate his death and that of the revolutionaries who died along with him in Bolivia. We will have our lunch at a small family farm near Santa Clara and head back to Havana where we will have some free time to freshen up before our farewell dinner, and of course, one final fun-filled night of music and dancing!

Included:

Activities: AM: Manaca Iznaga Sugar mill visit. Santa Clara museum. PM: travel back to 

HavanaMeals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Accommodation: Homestay

Day 9: Departure day

Say good-bye to our guide as we head back to the U.S. Don’t forget to set aside the 25CUC for your exit tax, or you may end up with an unplanned extension to your vacation!  And don’t worry if you forget, we will remind you!

If you would like to book your trip please go to www.globedriftertours.com

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

Qi Gong is a part of traditional Chinese medicine that views and treats the body, mind and the environment as a whole. Qi Gong practices include slow body movements, meditation, and special breathing techniques. Qi Gong students can experience deep relaxation, concentration and a peaceful, clear mind. In addition, Qi Gong practices help to clear energy blockages and improve blood circulation in the body. -Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

results.description: The Conservancy is helping West Orange to construct an extension of the Lenape Trail on the northern border of the Reservation. We need a large turnout to clear a couple of thousand feet of trail in a single morning. Volunteers from the environmental club of nearby Newark Academy are already signed up, but we need another dozen people. Bring loppers and rakes (spring and bow), if you have them. We will meet at Ellison Ave., right off Mt. Pleasant Ave. (Route 10). Trail building is very satisfying, but can be hard work. We use hand tools such as picks and adzes to create and shape the trail tread. Wear shoes with solid soles and long pants…dress in layers. Meet at: In front of 1 Ellison Ave., West Orange. The trail goes south from there. For information, call John Verzani [masked]), or Dennis Percher [masked]).

results.description:
Vegan food, fashion, helping animals and NYC.  What a great combination!

I got this email from a friend and think this would be a great opportunity to visit NYC again! We've had 2 NYC trips and they went great.  We can visit vegan restaurants in the area and go for a run in the morning in Central Park.

Here's the info:

On November 21, 2015, there is an amazing Vegan Fashion Show in Manhattan, New York City, including our 3rd conference. All info on this site:

www.afsconference.org

- It will be a one-day event from 9am-11pm. We’ll be featuring great vegan designers from NYC, Italy and UK. We will have keynote speakers and exhibitors, and a reception from 6:00pm-7:30pm with great vegan food, and a vegan cash bar, followed by the fashion show that ends at 11pm. All that at very reasonable fees as you will see on this link:

www.afsconference.org/REGISTRATION2015.html

- If you are also interested in exhibiting, we are now accepting applications. I do hope to see you there! The Anti-Fur Society

www.antifursociety.org

is an online group with a worldwide reach (see our FB page:

http://on.fb.me/139ldoW

) educating people about the cruelty of fashion that’s based on products derived from animals. Among other things as part of this activism, we’ve been holding conferences focused on fur-bearing animals on fur farms and in the wild. For more information click on “contact us” on

www.afsconference.org

Please do share with your friends!

results.description:
Please save the date for our upcoming Thanksgiving Dinner Group Volunteer activity at YWCA Brooklyn on Saturday November 21, 2015:


Who:  YWCA Young Women Advisory group, the Young Professionals of the Metro NY Chapter of the USNC for UN Women and compassionate volunteers.

What:  A Thanksgiving meal for 150 YWCA residents, women survivors of domestic violence.

When:  Saturday November 21, 2015, 10am-9pm (shifts vary such as 10am-2pm for meal prep, decorating and setup, 2pm-6pm also for meal prep, decorating and setup and 5:30pm-9pm for serving dinner, waiters/waitresses and clean up)

Where:  30 Third Avenue, Brooklyn NY. On the corner of Atlantic Avenue.

The Atlantic-Pacific/Barclays Center Train station (2/3/4/5/B/N/Q/R) or the Fulton Ave (C) are a short walk away.

Why:  Ending Violence Against Women is one of UN Women's pillars, a major part of the focus of the 2016 CSW and YWCA of Brooklyn actively supports this on a local scale. It precedes 16 Days of Action but is very much a part of it.

How:  RSVP here by no later than Sunday November 15. Spaces fill up quickly, please respond as soon as you can.  Also, we will will try to accommodate shifts as much as possible, but will defer to YWCA for the greatest needs.  If you have any questions, please send us an email at [masked].


Volunteers are also welcome to donate pies, ice cream, coffee cups and dessert cups. If you are unable to volunteer but could drop off a donation at YWCA by Friday November 20th, please let us know so we could put you in touch with YWCA and arrange that.  


Please note that the YWCA is NOT a shelter and this activity is NOT a soup kitchen.  The YWCA residence is the first apartment these women have moved into since leaving their abusive environment and transitioning out of the shelter. We are being invited to their home.  Please be mindful and sensitive of that when you share this event and use the appropriate language. We will get information from YWCA on what is appropriate and will share with you. 


Thank you for considering giving your time to make this a special night for these women. 


Best,


YP Co-Chairs


OTHER NEWS:


**Upcoming Event:  Next Monday, November 2,[masked]pm-UN Women and the CUNY Graduate Center will host an event about Gender and Equality.  This event is free, click here for more information and to reserve your spot:  Gender & Equality


Have you seen Suffargette?  If not, you should.  Maybe we could go see it together!  Also, make sure you are registered to vote.
results.name: Ywca Volunteer Thanksgiving

We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
Let's get into the spirit of giving by partnering with the New York Basket Brigade on Saturday November 21st -- starting 9 in the morning in Hartsdale. Further details on timing etc will be posted...

The New York Basket Brigade is built on a simple notion: one small act of generosity on the part of one caring person can transform the lives of hundreds. It takes only one light to dispel the darkness, and even just one basket or a few, to bring hope! A Basket Brigade takes place when one individual prepares one basket to personally deliver to a needy family or individual.a

Basically this organization collections donations - products or funds and we all meet at a home to assemble the food into gift baskets containing everything a family would need for a thanksgiving -- turkey, stuffing, cranberries, fruits, veggies drinks salad, bread, etc.. and after a huge assembly line production, folks can leave or stay to volunteer as drivers -- two or three per car -- to make deliveries. 

I did this one year - it was so gratifying..  you are given a route, with maps and information, and about five or six deliveries to make in a specific area.  So when I did it -- I delivered in Mt. Vernon, since I live here and was familiar with the neighborhoods.. It was a full fun day -- and later that evening we have a meetup movie scheduled so we can ALL GO AND REST OUR WEARY BONES FEELING THAT WE MADE A DIFFERENCE IN SOMEONE'S LIFE FOR THE BETTER.. 

Here's a picture of the group from the year I did this   - I am in red in the back left. 

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/5086e379e4b0a365d7fec449/50ac82d7e4b04170ccadd937/50ac82d9e4b079767f99c52e/1353482979225/Vbai2X0tmFBGWc4Z609fG-AIGicuq7CueacIIE4EcxQ%252Cmwneegbv6bC5zutE1FmyVZTZRE34z10McCoTdfmLyew.jpeg?format=750w

Won't you help??  Please join me in this day of service.. 

DONATIONS: *** MAIL-IN Donations must be received by Nov. 13 – $ 40 if paid in checks or cash *** (DO NOT MAIL IN CASH) *** 

On-line Donations must be received by Nov. 11 by going to http://nycbasketbrigade.com for more details! COST $ 45 on-line **** 

****Donations of any amount are graciously accepted**** 

Please copy and distribute this flyer throughout your community. If we each get 2-3 more volunteers or donations, it double or triples the number of families we can reach! For more information go to http://nycbasketbrigade.com


HOW:   

Volunteers: Click HERE to register to volunteer.

Include name, address, phone number, e-mail address, days you can volunteer and if you can be a driver. 

Be sure to specify which date(s)! DRIVER ARE NEEDED BOTH DAYS!!!! 

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/5086e379e4b0a365d7fec449/50ac82d7e4b04170ccadd937/50ac831ee4b04170ccadda51/1353483041386/533558_10200155629244188_1297328758_n.jpeg?format=1000w

The New York Basket Brigade is associated with the  International Basket Brigade, providing baskets of food and household items for an estimated 2 million people annually in countries all over the world through local grass roots efforts. Throughout the years International Basket Brigade volunteers deliver food, clothing, and hope to those who need it most. We would be honored to have you become a part of this truly wonderful event in your local community.


No meetup fee for this event.. as it is a fundraiser..
